**What we offer** 



* Flexible working hours
* Hybrid (around 2 days/week at the office)
* Skill development
* Salary and equity package
* The opportunity to make an impact
* Fast growing company in interesting space



  





 Please apply right away, we will reach out to you within 2 days.

title: Fullstack-utvecklare till Multisoft!
description:
Är du en erfaren utvecklare som är redo för nästa steg i karriären? Har du dessutom ett starkt intresse för framtida system och automatisering? Då kan rollen som Fullstack-utvecklare hos Multisoft vara den perfekta möjligheten för dig! Ansök redan idag och få chansen att arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser.
 



  

**Företag :**
 Multisoft AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Multisoft är ett spännande bolag som arbetar med att bygga systemlösningar åt stora företag. Multisoft utvecklar och levererar automatiserade och anpassningsbara system som är både tids- och resurseffektiva så att deras kunder kan fokusera på kreativa uppgifter och långsiktiga mål i stället för trasslig administration. Sedan starten 1995 har Multisoft vuxit sig till ett företag med 100+ medarbetare och över 400 levererade system.
 


  


 Multisoft har dessutom blivit utsedd till Europas 12:e bästa arbetsplats och varit en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplats åtta år i rad. (Great Place To Work, medelstora organisationer).
 


  


 Softadmin® är Multisofts low-code plattform där de skapar anpassningsbara, integrerade och automatiserade systemlösningar åt sina kunder. Det är marknadens mest effektiva low-code plattform som bygger på standardkomponenter med en stor flexibilitet och skalbarhet. Några av kunderna som Multisoft har hjälpt är Volvo, Ica, Vattenfall och Swedbank. Här kan du läsa mer om några av deras kundcase.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En arbetsplats som värderar socialt engagemang och arbete tillsammans för att skapa en öppen, stimulerande och respektfull arbetskultur
  
* Konferensresor varje år - varav en i Sverige och en utomlands
  
* Medarbetarstyrda fritidsaktiviteter och klubbar inom bland annat mat, musik och träning
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Plattformen Softadmin® är ett low code-verktyg som accelererar systemdesign och utveckling. Plattformen används av många andra systemutvecklare på Multisoft och revolutionerar effektiviteten i framtagandet och vidareutveckling av nya system. I denna roll kommer du genom experimenterande och utanför-boxen-tänkande vara med att vidareutveckla något som tillför mycket stort värde på marknaden både för utvecklare och slutanvändare.
 


  

  
* Som Fullstack-utvecklare jobbar du med C#, .NET, JavaScript, TypeScript samt avancerad T-SQL.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en universitetsutbildning inom relevant område (t.ex. civilingenjör inom datateknik eller teknisk fysik)
  
* Har minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av en liknande roll
  
* Har goda kunskaper inom C#, Java och SQL
  
* Har goda kunskaper av TypeScript eller JavaScript
  
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Ett intresse för low-code
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är självgående, driven, målinriktad och problemlösande.**



  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Multisoft AB**

 Läs mer om Multisoft här .
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Multisoft AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sally Ismail eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106313

title: Developer
description:
**Who We Are**
 Our group is developing applications that enable collaboration and product information sharing within the Traton family, including MAN and Navistar. As an example of what we do, one application we are currently building is tracker that visualises and shows the progress of our directional data flows between the different systems we work with.
   

  

 Today, our development work is done in five agile teams, supported by two architects and a broader SAFe framework in which we are organised. The teams consist of a good mix of people with different backgrounds, interests and skills, and are really motivated to learn together to develop further.
   

  

 Some of our teams are also cross-brand teams, meaning they include people from different brands within the Traton family. This creates a unique environment with a strong focus on empathy, building trust, and working together across organisations to accomplish shared goals.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Software Developer to join one of our development teams!
   

  

**Your profile**
 In our group, you will be part of our change journey together with colleagues at other Traton brands. You will work in the forefront with some of our emerging business needs, as we increase collaboration between brands.
   

  

 When we asked one of our architects what kind of profile we’re looking for, she said that “we expect a developer to bring curiosity to every task, whether they’re delving into new technologies, debugging complex problems, or brainstorming innovative solutions.”
   

  

 Our other architect reminded us to add a bit more about the team structure: how as a developer in the group you will work closely with solution architects, UX designers, other developers, and systems analysts in a streamlined agile team.
   

  

 As a developer, we know you can have a number of specialisations. You can be a front-end developer, or a back-end developer. You can be specialised in CI/CD pipelines, or unit testing frameworks. Whatever your specialisations are, we want to hear from you. We expect that you have one or a few specialisations that are particularly interesting to you, and we’d love to know what they are.
   

  

 Experience from several different programming languages and environments is also helpful, as we work with a broad range of applications. Most importantly though, we know that the person we’re looking for is not afraid to learn new skills. You are first and foremost a software developer, but in that role, the tools you use, the programming languages and frameworks, change over time.
   

  

 Furthermore, we expect you to express yourself fluently in English, written as well as spoken. If you speak other languages, this is meritorious as we work in a highly international area.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
 As a Scania employee, you have an almost endless variety of future professional development opportunities and great colleagues. Within our group, you will have the possibility to be part of, and shape, our future journey. We recognize each others' contributions, enjoy working together and support each other.
   

  

 Working at Scania you are offered benefits such as a result based bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours and lunch at reduced prices. We offer good opportunitors to balance your work commitments with your private life. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service from Stockholm City, via Liljeholmen to Södertälje, called Scania Job Express. We often work two days a week from out offices in Södertälje but are flexible about when and how to meet each other.
   

  

 When you are in the office, you can choose from several different offices, including our activity-based offices with a lot of creative and flexible spaces. We also have an office hub close to the central station in Stockholm that you can use whenever you like. You can also use Scania Go to transport yourself between the different locations using our on-call internal buses or electric bikes.
   

  

**Further information**
 For more information about the position, please contact Group Manager Jonas Öberg at jonas.oberg@scania.com. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition Specialist chandrani.ghosh@scania.com.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should contain CV and a personal letter. Scania is using tests as a part of the recruitment process and interviews can be held during the application period. Please apply via the portal as soon as possible, but no later than 2024-09-12.
   

  

 Kindly notice that a background check may be conducted for this position.

title: Developer
description:
**About The Job**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Software Test Developer to join our dynamic team.
   

  

 As Senior Software Test Developer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our ‘Diagnostic Platform’ (a comprehensive set of AWS services and applications used in for example updating vehicle software , reading diagnostics data and much more).
   

  

 You will primarily analyse our infrastructure, test tools and automation set-up used today and recommend how to improve and enhance it. We are looking to build a range of test frameworks that can be cross-functional and will be able to verify our platform as a whole or by independent services. You will work in cross-functional teams, have a strong technical background, pay attention to detail, and have a passion for delivering high-quality products. You also thrive in a fast-paced agile environment.
   

  

**Job Title:** 
 Senior Software Test Developer
   

  

**Company:** 
 Scania Research and Development
   

  

**Location:** 
 Södertälje
   

  

**Job Description:** 
 In your role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing automated testing frameworks and strategies that ensure the quality and reliability of our software products. You will collaborate closely with development teams to integrate automated testing into the software development lifecycle.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain automated test scripts using C#/Python and other relevant tools.
* Design and implement test plans, test cases, and test scenarios to verify software functionality and performance.
* Collaborate with software developers and stakeholders to identify and prioritize testing requirements.
* Execute and analyze test results, identify defects, and work closely with the development team to resolve issues.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving software quality processes.
* Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging technologies in software testing.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Test Developer or similar role, with a focus on C# development.
* Strong proficiency in C# programming language and object-oriented design principles.
* Experience with automated testing frameworks such as NUnit, MSTest, or similar.
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration tools (e.g., Jenkins).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Effective communication skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


**Benefits:**
 Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

  

* Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement.
* Flexible work schedule and a supportive work environment.
* Access to cutting-edge technologies and training resources.
* Employee wellness programs and other perks.


 Join our team and contribute to the success of our innovative software solutions. Apply now and become part of our dynamic and diverse workforce!
   

  

 Kindly apply with your CV and a Cover Letter with no later than 2024-09-25. For more information feel free to contact Jason Murphy (jason.murphy@scania.com).We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Full-stack Developer
description:
Join as a visionary Full Stack Developer, leading transformative development with integrated solutions across front and back-end, bridging the technology-business gap and shaping the future with innovative user experiences.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Join as a Full Stack Developer and lead transformative development, crafting innovative solutions across front and back-end with integrated services and APIs. Embrace your leadership role, creating conceptual architecture to meet precise client needs, while bridging the technology-business gap with exceptional communication. Elevate your career in this dynamic journey of Full Stack Development, shaping the future and making a lasting impact on clients. Together we do what matters.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
 Programming: C# / .NET, JavaScript/TypeScript Service Development: building web applications and web APIs using ASP.Net and cloud services (Azure/AWS/GCP) Cloud: Azure and others Database: (worked with one or more of) SQL Server, Azure SQL, Entity Framework Design & Style: HTML5, Responsive/Adaptive Design, CSS3, Bootstrap Frameworks: (Worked with one or more of) Angular, React, NodeJS, Vue.js, or equivalent JavaScript DevOps: Git, Azure DevOps
   

  

**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge. Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication. Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions. Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Analyze, design, develop, implement and maintain application code in a variety of contexts. Use .NET and Azure ecosystem to build scalable applications which power modern framework-driven web apps. Build and automate the features and services that model complex business problems, power enterprise-scale systems and drive innovative user experiences. Implement APIs and Microservices through database design, data access and ORMs and consume said APIs to build feature-rich applications. Develop scalable and cloud-based solutions, with consideration to security and performance. Harness modern development and Azure DevOps practices including CI/CD, containerization, automated testing.
   

  

**Learn more**
 Interested to hear more? Apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade: Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications). Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally. Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth. Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you.
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

title: Developer
description:
We are a group of 12 people and we are now looking for reinforcement with an enthusiastic and sharp developer of control functions!
   

  

**Your work assignments**
 You will develop and be responsible for steering functions and by that, we mean steering in the form of steering wheel and wheels that turn, but also how to remotely control autonomous vehicles so that they follow a given path.
   

  

 In this role, you are expected to work with colleagues to systemize, implement/code, test, analyze and document the new functions and their tools. You will develop functionality for driver support functions such as Lane Keep Assist. The group also develops autonomous steering functions and interactions between teams is promoted. Many of our projects lay the foundation for how steering controls will work in future generations of manual driven & autonomous vehicles, on a global scale.
   

  

 In the group, we work both with in-house developed products but also with together with suppliers. We test our systems in vehicles to see that everything works in reality and that we have thought of all relevant effects. An extra challenge is that we also cooperate with our sister brands MAN and Navistar with all the configurations a truck can have.
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to take a truck driver's license as part of the work. We work cross-functional with groups for mechanics, integration, and autonomy so you will have a wide network of contacts in the company and you will see real results from what you develop!
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are looking for you who are attracted by personal and technical challenges, and who like to work and collaborate with talented and creative colleagues. You thrive in a work environment where you can take on high personal responsibility and challenge our technologies, working methods, and processes.
   

  

 Energy, curiosity, creativity, and accuracy are qualities that you value and want to use in your work. You enjoy working in teams and solving problems with the help of others. You spread positive energy and enjoy sharing your knowledge!
   

  

 You preferably have a master's degree in computer/electronics/machine and several years of experience in product development of complex systems, control technology, algorithm development, Matlab/Simulink, and can communicate well in English and Swedish.
   

  

 Does it feel interesting? Do not hesitate to contact us!
   

  

**Scania offers**
 As an employee at Scania, in addition to career and development opportunities, we offer other benefits such as wellness allowance, staff car, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje - Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

 For more information, please contact Oskar Nydahl, Head of steering applications, 08-553 719 65
   

  

**Application**
 Please send in your CV with no later than 2024-09-22. A background check will be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Seize this career opportunity for advancement within the dynamic technical domain of autonomous technology, shaping your professional course at the forefront of automotive innovation.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!

title: Software Engineer (Python/Linux/Packaging)
description:
Canonical delivers open source software to millions of Linux, Windows and Mac machines through Ubuntu and the wider Canonical ecosystem. We are expanding our scope, to help developers ship their software efficiently to clouds and IoT devices.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for a talented software engineer with a passion for developer experience and build tooling to have a positive impact on the day-to-day workflow of thousands of snap and charm publishers. To be successful on this team you'll need to be interested in packaging formats, build systems and automation that can simplify the lives of developers and engineers trying to ship software to the widest possible audience.
   

  

 We design and maintain specialist Python tools to support the developer build and publication process. The team takes responsibility for tooling that builds snaps, charms and more recently, rocks (OCI images).
   

  

 Snapcraft allows developers to deliver app updates to millions of Linux systems automatically, eliminating the long tail of supported releases and complex install instructions. Snapcraft enables thousands of applications from over a thousand developers, including well-recognised names like Spotify, Slack, and Microsoft.
   

  

 Likewise, Charmcraft enables collaboration between charmed operator developers, and publication on Charmhub, home of the Charmed Operator Collection. Charmed Operators enable developers to package software like databases, event queues, caches, observability tools, identity tools and more, right alongside the operations code that enables teams to integrate and operate that software at scale from Day 0 to Day 1,000, and beyond.
   

  

 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You have expertise in Python.
* You have a strong understanding of the makeup of a modern GNU/Linux distribution.
* You have a good understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation.
* Experience working with container technology, such as Docker, Kubernetes and LXD.
* Use your familiarity with languages, toolchains, frameworks, integrations, and CI systems to extend the snap build ecosystem
* Work with external open source and commercial projects to understand how we can better serve community needs.


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Turnpikes söker utvecklare!
description:
Är du passionerad inom IT och söker nya utmaningar? Turnpikes erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans med ett team av engagerade kollegor. Välkommen till ett företag i framkant av teknik och innovation!
 


  

  

  

  


  

**Företag :**
 Turnpikes Sweden Filial
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Turnpikes är en talangfull grupp människor med huvudkontor i Danmark men verksamma över hela världen, som möjliggör digital transformation för företagskunder. Turnpikes värdesätter sina starka relationer, strävar alltid efter att skapa värde och är stolta över sin extremt höga kundnöjdhet från några av världens största företag.
 


  


 Med en ständigt växande kundbas har behovet av ytterligare expansion blivit tydligt. Nu söker vi utvecklare som i en bred roll kommer få ta stort ansvar gentemot den svenska kundbasen. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniska uppgifter relaterade till OpenText Extended ECM (Enterprise Content Management) och leverera kvalitativa konfigurationer till projektteamet som definierar omfattningen och interagerar med slutkunden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En fot in på ett företag vars tillväxtstrategi är ambitiös och där du får utrymme att växa i karriären
  
* Tydliga utvecklingsplaner och en platt struktur som ger dig tillgång till en stor kunskapsbas
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi och branschledande lösningar
  
* Omfattande förmånspaket
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Arbeta med definierade uppgifter i OpenText Extended ECM, som Web Reports, arbetsflöden, arkivhantering, etc.
  
* Leverera hög kvalitet i konfigurationer, utvecklingar och relaterad dokumentation.
  
* Samarbeta i ett större projektteam och kommunicera med dina kollegor på olika platser i världen.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant universitetsutbildning inom IT
  
* Har en god generell teknisk förståelse
  
* Har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
  
* Har grundläggande erfarenhet av databashantering
  
* Kan kommunicera väl på både svenska och engelska
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**

title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




 Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.
 



  





 You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.
 



  





  





**About you?** 




 You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI. You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.
 



  





 You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



  





 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





  





*3 stage Interview Process* 



1. *Initial Chat*
2. *Technical Discussion*
3. *Final with CEO*

title: Senior React Native Developer – 10303
description:
We are looking for a Senior React Native Developer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What You Will Work On:** 




  




* Develop and maintain a unified mobile app platform using React Native.
* Lead the migration process from existing native Android and iOS apps to React Native.
* Collaborate with backend teams to integrate APIs, ensuring smooth communication between mobile applications and backend services.
* Work closely with business and technical stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient mobile solutions.
* Contribute to the team’s continuous improvement efforts by participating in code reviews, testing, and implementing best practices in mobile development.
* Ensure quality through automated UI testing, end-to-end testing, and the use of mobile testing frameworks.
* Manage app distribution to ensure seamless updates and smooth delivery to users.



  





**What You Bring:** 




  




* 3+ years of experience in React Native development.
* Proven experience in transitioning native apps to React Native.
* Strong knowledge of mobile development for both iOS and Android platforms, including native capabilities.
* Proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
* Experience with API integration to ensure seamless communication between front-end and back-end systems.
* Familiarity with mobile testing frameworks, automated UI testing, and end-to-end testing methodologies.
* Experience with app distribution and deployment processes.
* Ability to work collaboratively in Agile environments and engage in problem-solving within a dynamic team setting.
* Excellent communication skills, with fluency in English; knowledge of a Scandinavian language is a plus.

title: 2024 Graduate Software Dev Engineer
description:

 Apply now

**Description**
 Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle?
   

  

 At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA.
   

  

 Our Software Development Engineers (SDEs) use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand.
   

  

 If this is you, come chart your own path at Amazon!
   

  

 The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and impact millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We’re looking for individuals who are excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.
* Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
* Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
* Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
* Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software.

* Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis.


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases
* Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation
* Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
* Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly.


 EMEA Student Programs Team
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. title: Fullstack Developer to Integration team | SEB, Solna
description:
Private and Corporate Digital Channels mission is to provide a world-class customer experience for SEB customers. The channels we are covering are different segments within our Business, such as Internet bank, Business arena, Mobile applications and Nexus.
   

  

 Now we are seeking for our new star in the Integration team who is driven to influence our application development for the present and for the future!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Fullstack developer you will work with development of SEB's API’s consumed by mobile applications for private, corporate and youth customers. You will be a part of a small team consisting of colleagues working with development, test and integration. In the role you will develop, maintain, design and implement new API’s. The applications displays most of SEB's services, therefore you will collaborate with a large variety of colleagues both from the IT and Business area. The applications are used by a large number of consumers, therefore we are actively ensuring that it is robust, scalable and accessible 24/7/365.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you take your own initiative in a technically competent team. As a person you can be constructive in a group and be inspired by taking responsibility and driving change through new technology. Thus, you will have the ability to collaborate with multiple colleagues, strong communication skills, driven and have an analytical mindset. You have a great interest in tools, architecture and design.
   

  

 We believe that you have:
   

  

* Experience in working with ASP.net and ASMX web services
* Experience in working with C#, YAML, GIT, TFS, Artifactory
* Experience in working with setting up and administrating a web site in IIS
* Experience of working with SQL to create, and edit tables and SPs
* Experience of working with CI/CD
* Experience of working with Design of API’s/micro-services and .NET Framewort/.NET
* Experience of working with Docker, Google cloud platform, Azure DevOps Server, OpenShift or similar platforms


 Fluency in English is required as it is our corporate language
   

  

 Fluency in spoken and written Swedish is also desirable (some documentation and code is written in Swedish).
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Deliver world-class service to customers
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits


 Ready to join?
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of September 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Agnes Kemper at agnes.kemper@seb.se. Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: PHP Developer, Jigsaw (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Jigsaw is searching for a PHP expert who thrives in fast-paced environments and is eager to drive technological advancements in the software industry. This role is ideal for someone who excels in PHP development and is passionate about leading teams towards innovation.
   

  

 The software industry often suffers from the slow pace of adopting new technologies and methodologies. At Jigsaw, we distinguish ourselves by rapidly embracing and implementing the latest cloud and PHP technologies. As our subject matter expert, you will be a catalyst in accelerating this shift, moving away from conventional development processes to more agile, efficient practices.
   

  

 Your role will involve leading the development and delivery of cutting-edge PHP solutions both in front-end and back-end services. Your expertise in PHP development will not only contribute to the creation of advanced software solutions, but also drive the strategic direction of our product offerings. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring our solutions align with client needs and industry trends.
   

  

 Joining Jigsaw means becoming part of a dynamic, forward-thinking company where innovative ideas are valued and professional growth is encouraged. If you're ready to join us in transforming the software domain, apply now!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Spearheading the development of customer-facing UIs and back-end services using PHP, ensuring scalable and efficient solutions
* Taking ownership of end-to-end project delivery, working closely with cross-functional Agile teams
* Guiding and mentoring a talented engineering team, promoting the use of best practices and fostering a culture of technical excellence


**Basic Requirements**
**PHP Developer key responsibilities**
* Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
* At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP development
* Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3) and MySQL
* The ability to integrate applications with third-party services using REST APIs with formats like JSON and XML


**About Jigsaw**
 Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
