title: Product Manager
description:
Skandiabanken är en nischbank med ett starkt fokus på bolån och har under de senaste åren tagit stora marknadsandelar från sina konkurrenter. Framgångarna kan tillskrivas en kombination av transparent prissättning, en effektiv digital process och ett ständigt arbete med att förbättra kundupplevelsen. Nu söker vi en ny Product Manager för låneområdet, då den tidigare har avancerat till en ny roll inom bankledningen.


**Product Manager | Skandia | Stockholm**



Som Product Manager (PM) har du det övergripande ansvaret för att produktområdet levererar enligt Skandiabankens affärsmål. Du ser till att produktteamet levererar med hög kvalitet och effektivitet. Du har självklart ett dedikerat och engagerat team till din hjälp där personalansvar ingår. Teamet består av tre Product Owners, fem produktspecialister och en UX-designer. Tillsammans ansvarar ni för att säkerställa att produkterna uppnår målen i bankens affärsplan.



Ditt ansvar omfattar även hantering av avtal och upphandling av både interna och externa tjänster, samt samarbetet med leverantörer. Du deltar i det strategiska arbetet kring framtida behov av leverantörer.



En viktig del av rollen är att vidareutveckla och implementera agila principer inom ramen för SAFe. Så här behöver du vara väl insatt i agila metoder och driva utvecklingen mot ökad agil mognad och affärsutveckling inom organisationen.



Du ansvarar för den långsiktiga roadmapen för området och säkerställer att regelverk och lagar följs, samt rapporterar regelbundet till affärschefen och bankledningen. Som PM arbetar du även nära andra produktchefer inom Skandiabanken för att hantera beroenden och samverka med övriga delar av Skandia.



Du kommer att ha tät kontakt med både interna och externa intressenter och ingå i ledningsgruppen för låneområdet, som består av Chef Front Office och Chef Back Office. Du rapporterar direkt till affärschefen för låna, som även är medlem i bankledningen.



Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som Product Manager:


* Besluta och kommunicera strategin för produktområdet Låna
* Personalansvar för Product Owners, produktspecialister och UX-designer och med det säkerställa att deras arbetsförutsättningar är optimala
* Implementera och utveckla agila principer och metoder, samt ansvara för övergången från projektorganisationen
* Sätta mål för produktteam och tillsammans med teamet utveckla relevanta KPI och mätetal för kontinuerlig förbättring
* Ansvara för riskhantering inom utveckling och förvaltning av produkterna
* Säkerställa att teamen har rätt förutsättningar för innovation och lärande i sitt arbete
* Följa marknaden noggrant, med fokus på kundernas behov och konkurrenternas agerande



Den här rollen innebär en central position i utvecklingen av Skandiabankens låneområde och erbjuder en unik möjlighet att påverka hur vi jobbar och vad vid erbjuder både strategiskt och operativt.


  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som kan utöva situationsanpassat ledarskap och har god affärsförståelse. Du har förmåga att zooma ut från detaljer till förmån för helheten på olika nivåer. En förmåga att kunna tänka såväl kort- som långsiktigt och kunna prioritera mellan aktiviteter som påverkar flera parter är viktigt. Du behöver snabbt kunna arbeta upp trygghet och integritet i rollen och lita på din förmåga att göra analys och dra slutsatser kopplat till övergripande strategier och mål. Du har god vana att hantera personer i olika befattning och med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.



Du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning och har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta praktiskt med agil IT- och produktutveckling i en ledande befattning. Dessutom har du tidigare haft roller med resultat- och/eller budgetansvar samt erfarenhet av personalansvar. Det är även viktigt att du har en god insikt i branschen.


Du behärskar svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift, och har obehindrade kunskaper i engelska.


**Ansökan**



Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor på Lindhagensgatan på Kungsholmen/Stockholm.


Vi genomför löpande urval så sök redan idag för att inte missa chansen.


Vårdförsäkringar och hälsoförsäkring


Vår företagskultur styrs av engagemang


Balans i livet och ett bra friskvårdserbjudande


Förmånlig tjänstepension


Bidrar till att göra skillnad


Förmånlig ränta på bolån


Extra semesterdagar


3 flexibla lediga dagar varje år

title: Product Manager
description:
Skandiabanken är en nischbank med ett starkt fokus på bolån och har under de senaste åren tagit stora marknadsandelar från sina konkurrenter. Framgångarna kan tillskrivas en kombination av transparent prissättning, en effektiv digital process och ett ständigt arbete med att förbättra kundupplevelsen. Nu söker vi en ny Product Manager för låneområdet, då den tidigare har avancerat till en ny roll inom bankledningen.
  
  

Product Manager | Skandia | Stockholm
  
  

Som Product Manager (PM) har du det övergripande ansvaret för att produktområdet levererar enligt Skandiabankens affärsmål. Du ser till att produktteamet levererar med hög kvalitet och effektivitet. Du har självklart ett dedikerat och engagerat team till din hjälp där personalansvar ingår. Teamet består av tre Product Owners, fem produktspecialister och en UX-designer. Tillsammans ansvarar ni för att säkerställa att produkterna uppnår målen i bankens affärsplan.
  
  

Ditt ansvar omfattar även hantering av avtal och upphandling av både interna och externa tjänster, samt samarbetet med leverantörer. Du deltar i det strategiska arbetet kring framtida behov av leverantörer.
  
  

En viktig del av rollen är att vidareutveckla och implementera agila principer inom ramen för SAFe. Så här behöver du vara väl insatt i agila metoder och driva utvecklingen mot ökad agil mognad och affärsutveckling inom organisationen.
  
  

Du ansvarar för den långsiktiga roadmapen för området och säkerställer att regelverk och lagar följs, samt rapporterar regelbundet till affärschefen och bankledningen. Som PM arbetar du även nära andra produktchefer inom Skandiabanken för att hantera beroenden och samverka med övriga delar av Skandia.
  
  

Du kommer att ha tät kontakt med både interna och externa intressenter och ingå i ledningsgruppen för låneområdet, som består av Chef Front Office och Chef Back Office. Du rapporterar direkt till affärschefen för låna, som även är medlem i bankledningen.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som Product Manager:**  

* Besluta och kommunicera strategin för produktområdet Låna
* Personalansvar för Product Owners, produktspecialister och UX-designer och med det säkerställa att deras arbetsförutsättningar är optimala
* Implementera och utveckla agila principer och metoder, samt ansvara för övergången från projektorganisationen
* Sätta mål för produktteam och tillsammans med teamet utveckla relevanta KPI och mätetal för kontinuerlig förbättring
* Ansvara för riskhantering inom utveckling och förvaltning av produkterna
* Säkerställa att teamen har rätt förutsättningar för innovation och lärande i sitt arbete
* Följa marknaden noggrant, med fokus på kundernas behov och konkurrenternas agerande


Den här rollen innebär en central position i utvecklingen av Skandiabankens låneområde och erbjuder en unik möjlighet att påverka hur vi jobbar och vad vid erbjuder både strategiskt och operativt.
  
Vi söker dig som kan utöva situationsanpassat ledarskap och har god affärsförståelse. Du har förmåga att zooma ut från detaljer till förmån för helheten på olika nivåer. En förmåga att kunna tänka såväl kort- som långsiktigt och kunna prioritera mellan aktiviteter som påverkar flera parter är viktigt. Du behöver snabbt kunna arbeta upp trygghet och integritet i rollen och lita på din förmåga att göra analys och dra slutsatser kopplat till övergripande strategier och mål. Du har god vana att hantera personer i olika befattning och med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
  
  

Du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning och har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta praktiskt med agil IT- och produktutveckling i en ledande befattning. Dessutom har du tidigare haft roller med resultat- och/eller budgetansvar samt erfarenhet av personalansvar. Det är även viktigt att du har en god insikt i branschen.
  
  

Du behärskar svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift, och har obehindrade kunskaper i engelska.
  
  

Ansökan
  
  

Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor på Lindhagensgatan på Kungsholmen/Stockholm. Vi genomför löpande urval så sök redan idag för att inte missa chansen.
  
  

Vi är tillräckligt små för att du kan göra skillnad men tillräckligt stora för att du kan växa.
  
  

Vi är det ledande pensionsbolaget som tar ansvar. Hos oss är engagemang, ansvarstagande och en vilja att utvecklas några av de egenskaper vi värderar högst. Vi tror att samarbete tar oss längre än vad någon enskild person kan göra.
  
  

Vi erbjuder tjänstepension med förebyggande hälsoförsäkring för att våra kunder ska kunna bygga grunden till en trygg pension och vara friska på vägen dit. Vi erbjuder också bolån och sparande samt förenklar sparandet för våra kunder genom vår rådgivning.
  
  

Av våra närmare 2 miljoner kunder är 1,4 miljoner också våra ägare. Det är deras behov och intressen som vi tar tillvara i utvecklingen av Skandia.
  
  

Vi sitter inte inne med alla svaren, det är därför vi behöver din hjälp att lösa morgondagens utmaningar. Ditt bidrag kommer att märkas!

title: UX-designer
description:
Är du en kreativ UX-designer med ett öga för detaljer och passion för att skapa användarvänliga digitala upplevelser? Har du dessutom erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling och ett intresse för generativ AI? Då kan det vara just dig vi söker till B3 Websteps Sitevision-team!  

  

**Rollbeskrivning**  

Du kommer att tillhöra B3 Websteps Sitevision-team som är en uppskattad Sitevision-partner med ett 100-tal lyckade leveranser i ryggen. Vi är Platinum Partner till Sitevision och teamet består av ett härligt gäng kollegor med gedigen kunskap inom området. Teamet jobbar med kunder spridda över vårt avlånga land och tätt tillsammans i leverans med daglig kontakt sinsemellan.  

  

I rollen som UX-designer så kommer du att delta i alla delar av designprocessen, från idé till färdig produkt. Vidare så kommer du att designa intuitiva och engagerade användargränssnitt, utföra användartester och analysera feedback för att kontinuerligt förbättra användarupplevelsen. Rollen innebär att du samarbetar nära med våra utvecklare i teamet för att implementera dina designlösningar i kod.

 **Vi söker dig som har:**  

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet som UX-designer, gärna med inslag av utveckling
* Kunskaper inom frontend-utveckling (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
* Erfarenhet av designverktyg så som Figma, Sketch eller Adobe XD
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med generativ AI och förståelse för dess tillämpning inom design
* Behärskar god svenska i tal och skrift

  

**Plats:**Stockholm, Uppsala eller Örebro **Vad vi erbjuder**


Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Webstep är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på **kompetensutveckling**, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi har även ett stort fokus på **sociala aktiviteter**, vi gillar att umgås med varandra helt enkelt!


B3 Webstep är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

 **Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**

 **Frågor?**  

Har du frågor om tjänsten så kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, på 070 288 11 67 eller petra.magnusson@b3.se

title: Function Owner
description:
Job Description


Within AFRY, we develop and deliver solutions for vehicles, systems, functions and attributes to customers in the automotive industry. Our customers are both established OEM's, startup companies and system suppliers (Tier 1). We operate all over the world; mainly in Sweden, China, Brazil, US and UK.


We are now looking for experienced Function Owner who will join into a function & System team and work on-site in our client side.


As an Function Owner, you will be focus on Conceptualize, develop and implement strategies to optimize the function overtime. You are also be able to develop and communicate the function version and set up the function roadmap. In order to secure cross-functional needs and priorities you are able to collaborating with internal and external stakeholders. Communicate the function's objectives, progress, and challenges to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner are also your responsibilities. You also have capability to identify bottlenecks and drive continuous improvement of existing and future functions, coordinate content dependencies with other FOs and all relevant stakeholders. More responsibilities for this role as below required:

* Engage with stakeholders, including business leaders, subject matter experts, and end-users, to understand and analyze high-level business requirements.
* Utilize various techniques such as interviews, workshops, surveys, and document analysis to gather information effectively.
* Break down complex business problems into manageable high-level requirements.
* Evaluate existing systems and processes to identify gaps and areas for improvement.
* Document high-level requirements clearly and concisely using industry-standard techniques.
* Create detailed business requirement documents and high-level use cases that outline the system's behavior without diving into technical details.


Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; advanced degree or certification
* Experience with customer facing function development and UX methodologies.
* Several years of experience in a similar function or related role, with a proven track record of successful function management.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Analytical mindset and problem-solving skills.
* Tools and process: Car weaver, FMEA, Hazard Analysis,


Meritorious if you have:

* Knowledge of relevant industry standards and best practices.
* Swedish driving license (B-level)


We are looking for a team player who like to share your knowledge with your colleagues. You have a good ability to work together with others, and you enjoy having a lot of responsibility and the opportunity to influence. In addition to this, you like to bring new suggestions and ideas to the table for the group's future development.


Company Description


*AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.*


Additional Information


You will work in interesting areas and environments with varying tasks. Your development is central and we will try to find the assignment that suits you and your development. You will belong to a successful global company and work together with inspiring and committed employees. We see each employee as an important piece of the puzzle in our joint success and work actively to create a developing and pleasant work environment through personal leadership. Above all, we have fun together!


Welcome with your application! During the Summer Holiday our feedback can be delayed, we will get back to you as soon as we can.


Daniel Sletteberg Loveryd- Section Manager  

daniel.slettebergloveryd@afry.com


Jie Qiao- Teamleader  

jie.qiao@afry.com


We refrain from direct contact with staffing and recruitment companies and sellers of additional job advertisements.

*Welcome with your application!*

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*


Apply information


Position


Function Owner
Location


Gothenburg
Country


Sweden
Reference number


REF8167X
company_addresses:
Our headquarters are in Stockholm, Sweden yet our businesses and clients extend right across the globe. 

Frösundaleden 2
SE 169 70, Stockholm

info@afry.com
+46105050000
company_description: AFRY is a European leader in engineering, design, and advisory services, with a global reach. We are 16,000 devoted experts in infrastructure, industry, energy and digitalisation.

title: Graphic Artist
description:
We're looking for a gifted artist who loves to draw, paint, compose, animate and explore the possibilities to push the look and feel of casino games to a new level. Your main job will be to create beautiful things. Those things are: backgrounds, characters, symbols and whatever you feel will add character and feeling to the game at hand.
   

  

 We want a perfectionist that is not afraid to get down and dirty with new styles that might not be what she/he is usually comfortable with, to be able to get a more diverse look throughout our portfolio. You will be an important part of the team, already from the early process of the project, sketching and exploring the game design close together with your team. Hence you have great conceptual skills and understand the difference of early stage “sketch-spouting” and final polish and render.
   

  

 You're not a drone. Your ideas matter. Meaning, you will be a part of a creative process that is creating a game together with skilled individuals from the Nolimit game team.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Strong visual skills and understanding of composition, anatomy color, light and shape
* Master diverse set of styles
* Dominion over PS, AI, AE and similar software. Z-brush sculpting is a plus
* Story boarding, animatics and scene composing is a plus


 Who you are
   

  

* You have the skills required and a vast imagination that is always ready for a challenge
* You have a an understanding of the game production process. Such as sketching for concepts and mockups as well as following the artistic vision for set project
* You take pride in delivering quality art. But not afraid to scrap a non-fulfilling delivery if the game benefits from it
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta, Romania and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Lead Content Designer
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.**
 We are looking for a Lead Content Designer to create exciting and long-lasting emotional impact for our users in all in-product experiences.
   

  

 As a lead content designer you will be working in partnership with design, marketing and technology and be responsible for hands on driving and executing the content that supports our digital products. This role is located at our HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**Job Summary:**
 Working with another senior content designer, you will be responsible for the content created for all in-product experiences. Day to day you will oversee the creation of processes, and ensure quality and governance of content, as well as being involved in working with product teams to create required content.
   

  

 You will be expected to lead, mentor and help your teammates, as well as ensuring the content design craft is represented outwardly - by working alongside key stakeholders to grow the profile of content and encourage cross-team collaboration.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Determine overall strategy for in-product content throughout all touchpoints and product experiences
* Ensure alignment of strategy with Brand & Marketing stakeholders and counterparts
* Oversee the creation of process and ensure quality and governance of content
* Participate in the production of content, e. g research, concepting, UI copy, microcopy, onboarding, tutorials, user flows, error handling, CTAs, style guides, accessibility, localization, in line with the domain’s or product team's strategy and roadmap
* Identify strategic solutions ahead of the current known roadmap by collaborating with product designers on product visioning through prototyping and storytelling
* Work across teams, coordinate requests from multiple teams and align work between teams as well as proactively find opportunities within multiple teams
* Establish systems and processes that will support the democratization of writing, and ensures a consistent tone of voice across the whole epidemic platform


**Requirements:**
* Great communicator and storyteller, experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with various stakeholders
* Trusted mentor to more junior team members, as well as confident educator to stakeholders
* Proven track record of delivering and measuring impact of content within a product organization
* Experience in creating tone of voice guidance and content strategy
* Excellent collaboration with UX design teams and inspiring content workshops skills


**Preferred Qualifications/ Bonus Skills:**
* Experience working in a complex, fast-moving product organization
* Having worked with or towards B2B/Enterprise
* Experience with a global customer base across multiple languages
* Experience of process mapping and defining new process


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 **Be sure to attach or link your portfolio to your application, we will not process applications with missing portfolios.**
 Epidemic Sound, the market leading platform for restriction-free music, is headquartered in Stockholm, heard around the globe and on a mission to soundtrack the world.The company has democratized access to music for storytellers. Its innovative digital rights model paves the way for creators - everyone from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s largest brands - to use restriction-free music to take their content to the next level, whilst simultaneously supporting the musicians it works with both financially and creatively.The company was co-founded in 2009, operates across the globe, and has offices in five major cities: Stockholm, New York, Los Angeles, Seoul and Amsterdam. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital, Alecta. AMF, and TIN Fonder and its Chairperson is Andrew Fisher, former CEO and Chairman of Shazam.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**The Role**
 We're looking for a SeniorProduct Designer who can build simple, human and engaging experiences to join our fast-growing Product design team here at Kindred Group! As a Product Designer, you will form part of a Design team, working closely with a cross-functional team consisting of Product Owners, Developers & business stakeholders. You will ensure outcomes are insight-driven, well explored and have been fully considered in line with the design process. Kindred Group is home to 9 of Europe's most successful online gambling brands (you will probably have heard of Unibet and 32 Red). You'll be working across our international brands, shaping experiences that make a difference to the lives of millions of sports betting, casino and bingo players.
   

  

 By championing a team culture based on mentorship and coaching, we ensure that every individual has career growth and personal development support. We provide dedicated training and tailor individual development plans to help everyone achieve their long-term career ambitions.
   

  

 As a multi-location team, we have a healthy balance between working from home and the office. Our UX team is built on friendliness, kindness, trust and respect. The whole team also speaks GIF! Learn more about Life within UX at Kindred and check our monthly podcast out. Designers create great customer experiences while also generating impact for our business. If you're looking to join a collaborative team where everyone has a voice and can contribute, then please apply.
   

  

 As a Senior Product Designer, you will play a central role in developing a key area of the overall user experience. You will work closely, as part of a Design team, with wider UX disciplines, tech teams and business stakeholders to ensure outcomes are insight driven, well explored and have been fully considered in line with the UCD design framework.
   

  

****What you will do****
* Gather data, insights, technical constraints, business requirements, and market-specific regulator needs to make evidence-based decisions.
* Use your experience and our multi-brand design system to deliver high quality user flows, concepts, prototypes, and carefully documented design solutions.
* Contribute to defining visions and roadmaps which considers both user needs and business goals.
* Collaborate with your design team and wider community to transform ideas into useful features and multi-channel experiences.
* Work closely with other Product Designers, Content Designers, UX Researchers, Product Owners and Developers within our end-to-end UCD design framework.
* Clearly present your outcomes, using story telling techniques, to different stakeholder groups.
* Build strong relationships and trust, ensuring we get the best from both our team members and those we work closely with.


****What we need from you****
* Be a champion of a user-centric approach with an ability to design meaningful features and experiences.
* Have proven experience in Product Design from a customer-centric area.
* Craft easy to use, accessible, and modular designs that can scale to millions of users.
* Ability to make pragmatic decisions whilst having the bigger picture in mind.
* Provide and receive actionable feedback from UX experts, business stakeholders and developers.
* Be a natural collaborator with diverse teams in a multi-faceted, complex and change prone environment.
* Effective communication skills paired with great storytelling and the ability to explain the rationale behind your design decisions.
* Expert knowledge of Figma (or Sketch / Adobe XD) and its core features such as auto-layout, component variants and libraries.
* Help develop, guide and support more junior team members.
* Deliver work to a high standard needing little or no guidance.
* Be capable and confident of running ideation or design workshops.

title: Senior Content Designer
description:
**The Role**
 We're looking for a
 **Senior Content Designer** 
 who can build simple, human and engaging experiences to join our fast-growing content design team here at Kindred Group!
   

  

 As a Senior Content Designer will work closely with Content designers, Product designers, the UX team and business stakeholders to ensure our experiences are human, simple and effective.
   

  

 Kindred group is home to 9 of Europe's most successful online gambling brands (you will probably have heard of Unibet and 32 Red). You'll be working across our international brands, shaping experiences that make a difference to the lives of millions of sports betting, casino and bingo players.
   

  

 Our UX team is built on friendliness, kindness, trust and respect. Content designers create great customer experiences while also generating impact for our business. If you're looking to join a collaborative team where everyone has a voice and can contribute, then please apply.
   

  

****What you'll be doing****
* Guiding and mentoring your fellow content designers in their content activities (such as running crits, workshops and collaborative design practices).
* Making the content across our 9 brands and products easier to use and more engaging for the customer.
* Contributing to the creation of the Content Design teams tools, processes and ways of working.
* Working with Product Designers to improve user journeys, create frictionless microcopy that inspires action.
* Actively advocate content design on design projects, making sure end-to-end journeys meet user needs and business objectives.
* Using research techniques, to quickly identify what's working in our journeys and opportunities to improve them.
* Engaging with stakeholders to understand business needs and bring them on board while advocating the value of user-centred design.
* You'll also write, edit, test and improve existing content across our brands


****We are looking for people who****
* Are experienced at presenting the rationale for design decisions and influencing stakeholders.
* Have an in-depth understanding and application of UX best-practice & accessibility guidelines .
* Worked with Design Systems, Style guides and Brand guidelines .
* Experience working with and running user research .
* Have experience of running Content crits and content workshops.
* Demonstrated strong content research skill (such as empathy mapping) to understand user need.
* Have a human centred and inclusive approach to content creation.
* Can build a hypothesis, change course, and adapt your approach because of user feedback.
* Can advocate of data-driven design and be able to explain how data informs your design.
* Enjoy building relationships with and can influence senior stakeholders.
* Are comfortable giving and receiving feedback on designs to reach the best solution that balances user and business needs.
* Have an open and friendly approach to working with others. As a strong collaborator, you'll work closely and build relationships with other designers, researchers, developers and product owners.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**KICKS recently joined Matas Group, and the group is now the Nordic leader within beauty and wellbeing with DKK +7.6bn revenue, +500 stores, +4,000 employees, +5M loyalty members, and e-commerce in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Finland. Matas Group operates with two retail banners across the markets: Matas in Denmark and KICKS in Sweden, Norway, and Finland offering a curated portfolio of third-party brands, In-House brands and an emphasis on personal and expert advisory and service excellence. Matas Group is listed on Nasdaq OMX Copenhagen.** 




  





**About the Role** 




  





 At Matas Group, we are committed to providing our customers with the best possible experience. To enhance our effectiveness in achieving this goal, we are strengthening our project team across the organization. We are therefore seeking a Technical Project Manager to join and support our digital project team at Matas Group.
 



  





 In this role you will be responsible for leading and coordinating technical projects from start to finish, across various solutions and platforms. Your ability to manage multiple projects and tasks both in parallel and across different departments and external suppliers will be crucial to your success in this role.
 



  





 Together with our development teams and business units, you will work closely to ensure the successful execution of projects. Technical expertise and experience with e-commerce platforms and services will be an advantage. You will be part of a skilled and passionate team focused on e-commerce, with the ambition of taking our online business to new heights.
 



  





 The role is located in our KICKS HQ in Stockholm, but regular travel to Matas HQ in Copenhagen will be expected. Your team members in Digital Projects are located at the offices in Denmark.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Manage technical projects fromA to Z
* Help colleagues with technical support and assist or advise on new initiatives
* Understand and translate commercial needs to help find the best technical solutions
* Collaborate with relevant parties to define solutions and ensure alignment across the organization
* Handover and coordinate with the development team, as well as assist in acceptance tests
* Contribute to standardizing and defining the framework for project processes and support to assist our business units and colleagues throughout the Matas Group
* Help ensure consistency across digital channels



  





**Your Profile** 




  




* You are outgoing, approachable, and provide strong technical support to your colleagues
* You can comprehend and communicate complex solutions effectively
* You work independently and manage projects with support and guidance from your department and manager
* You are comfortable working closely with the development team and take ownership of your projects
* You approach challenges with a solution-orientedmind-set
* You have a keen eye for user experience, UX, and interaction design
* Your language skills: Swedish and English is a requirement, Danish proficiency is just a plus



  





**Your Background** 




  




* You have a relevant IT-education with a technical background
* You have experience as an E-Commerce Manager, Project Manager, or Project Coordinator, ideally combined with programming experience or technical skills
* You have some experience with enterprise commerce and the complexities which follows



  





**What we Offer** 




  




* A dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and excellence
* Flexibility including the option for two remote working days per week
* Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the organization



  





 If you're ready to join a dynamic team with a strong mission, we want to hear from you! The recruiting is on-going and once we’ve found the right candidate the position will be closed – we look to hear from you.

title: Sportsbook - Head of Design
description:
As the Head of Design, you will be responsible for ensuring the delivery of high-quality UX/UI for our Sportsbook Product. You will lead and mentor the design team, guiding them in creating innovative and user-centric designs. Your contributions will play a critical role in the overall success of the SB Product, while also improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the entire SB Product Team.
   

  

**The Wow**
 The Betsson Group’s mission is to put customers at the heart of our business through unrivalled customer experiences, and you will play a crucial part in achieving that mission. As a Head of Design for the sportsbook product, you will work across multiple brands in markets across the world serving millions of customers. As part of a dynamic customer experience centred department the Design team play a crucial role in driving a customer-first approach.
   

  

 Your main stakeholders will include the Head of Products, Product Managers, and Product Owners, with whom you will collaborate closely to drive UX/UI improvements. You will work alongside Tech Teams, including Engineering Managers and Developers, to ensure that design deliverables are well-suited for smooth and effective implementation. Additionally, you will engage with B2B Partners and Commercial Stakeholders, presenting and advocating for UX/UI enhancements to ensure alignment with business goals.
   

  

**A Taste Of What You'll Be Doing**
* Set the overall vision & direction for the UX / UI of our SB Product
* Ensure high quality UX / UI in terms of user flows and visuals
* Ensure effective design processes to produce high-quality designs
* Ensure effective ways of working between the Design team, the rest of SB Product Team (e.g. User Research) & Engineering
* Ensure a user centric design process where UX / UI improvements are based on data and user insights where relevant
* Build and manage a best in class Design team and enable designer managers in the organization to lead their respective teams
* Evangelize the Sportsbook product vision within Betsson Group


**What We're Looking For**
* Master’s degree in Design, Arts or similar
* +10 years in Product Design and minimum of 5 years as a Design Manager / Head of Design
* Preferably experience from igaming and specifically from Sportsbook
* Strong track record of successfully leading large design teams for complex digital products.


**What We Offer**
 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 At Betsson Group we work with a Hybrid Work From Home (WFH) model, giving you the flexibility of working 2 days in the office and 3 days at home.
   

  

 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
   

  

 Challenge accepted?
   

  

***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy.***

title: Copywriter & Communication specialist, Solna-Hybrid
description:
***Be a part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us at PostNord. Join the Go to Market team in Stockholm!***
*Are you a talented copywriter with a knack for product communication? Do you have the creativity and strategic thinking to engage diverse audiences through compelling messaging? If so, we want to hear from you! You will be part of a Customer Experience team working close to designers but also other stakeholders like sales, communication and product owners.*
 Join us
   

  

 You, as a communication specialist have important role to play in making our digital products understandable. Biggest part of your role is to support internal stakeholder like UX designer, product owners, CX and other important stakeholders like communications teams in countries.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm. We believe in flexible working arrangements and combine working from home as well as at the office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop clear, engaging, and persuasive copy for various digital channels, including Postnord business portal, app, but also social media, email campaigns and product descriptions.
* Collaborate with product teams to understand key product features, benefits, and differentiators, translating that information into compelling messaging for target audiences.
* Create content that aligns with our brand voice and guidelines, ensuring consistency across all channels.
* Work closely with the other internal stakeholder like sales, communication teams in each market and go to market team for Nordics to craft communication strategies that highlight product launches, promotions, and events.
* Analyze the performance of content and adjust strategies based on insights and feedback to enhance engagement and conversion rates.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and competitor activities to inform content development and positioning.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Communications, English, or a related field or work experience. Least 4 years’ work experience.
* Fluent Swedish and English Proven experience in copywriting and product communication, preferably in a marketing or advertising environment.
* Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a keen attention to detail.
* Ability to translate complex information into clear and engaging copy that resonates with diverse audiences.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO best practices. Creative thinker who can generate innovative ideas for messaging and content.
* Proficient in using content management systems and digital marketing tools.
* Experience in CMS-systems regarding publishing online


 We offer you
   

  

* Agile is our way of working, we have daily's, refinement meetings and sprint retros.
* Flexible hybrid workplace, with an open working climate. You can work from home 2 days in the week.
* To be part of a large organization with endless development opportunities for you as a developer and individual.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com.
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, email sonja.prest@postnord.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Click here for union contact
   

  

 #.NET #joinusatdigital

title: Data Engineer
description:
**We are people who want to make a difference.**


Everything we do starts with people. It’s what makes us different from all other car companies. If you share our belief in the power of people and our passion for human-centric innovation, you will thrive together with brilliant, like-minded colleagues who are committed to making a true difference?

  



Our organization enables harnessing the power of data to sculpt the future of automotive safety technology. We're seeking an experienced Data engineer to strengthen our data processing for handling test and customer data.

  

**What you will do**  



* Design, Build, and Maintain Data Pipelines
* Data Integration
* Optimize performance for data processing systems.
  


**Who You Are:**


* Experienced Professional: You have 5+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong understanding of ETL processes, data warehousing, and big data technologies.
* Technical Expertise:
	+ Strong competence in programming languages such as Python
	+ Experience from working in Unix/Linux environments and shell scripting.
	+ Software development workflow (GitLab, Gerrit and Jenkins) and Containerization, Kubernetes and PBS.
	+ Basic experience in Database systems preferable in Relational database, SQL, NoSQL
	+ Experience with data engineering tools and platforms like Apache Spark, Hadoop
	+ Experience from system development with Cloud systems like AWS/GCP/Azure.
	+ Experience with Airflow is meritorious.
* Problem Solver: You possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
* Team Player: You have strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling you to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Adaptable and Innovative: Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, you embrace change and are always looking for new ways to enhance data processes and technologies.
* Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

  


**Who are we?**


Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

  

  

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software development that makes a difference**


At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

  


**What you’ll do**

  

  

You will be part of Commercial Digital and our cluster Fleet.

  

  

As a Software Engineer you enable product success by working as a liaison among different stakeholders to understand the customer benefits and needs, and by supporting backlog refinement in accordance with the Product Manager and the team’s agenda. You will be part of the whole development lifecycle, not only the actual implementation in code.

  

  

Your responsibilities will be to create digital capabilities and applications and to facilitate a grounded way of working with focus on value creation and excellent user experience.

  

  

As self-development is one of our core competencies, you are also responsible for providing a learning culture where our employees grasp and get the opportunity to grow with the business.

  

  

**What you’ll bring**

  

  

We are looking for a creative and driven Software Engineer with some years of experience in building cloud-native web applications using React, .NET Core and Azure cloud. Knowledge of Domain Design, API-Design and Cloud Architecture is a merit.

  

  

We believe that you have a master’s degree or equivalent combination of education and some years of work experience. Moreover, we think that you have experience of:

  

  

• React (TypeScript), .NET Core (C#)  

* Web development (backend and frontend)
* Cloud based services, such as Azure or AWS
* Document based databases, such as CosmosDB or MongoDB
* Creating CI/CD pipelines, preferably in Azure DevOps or with GitHub actions
* Test driven development and test automation
* Integration techniques, both synchronous and asynchronous
* Writing well designed, testable, efficient code by using software development best practices
* Agile methodologies and mindset
* Working with analytics, understanding the data and what gaps require actions
  

Experience of working with business development as well as hands-on experience from the car industry is a plus.

  

  

**Who you are**

  

  

We are looking for you who has a genuine interest in people and can build trusted relationships. You will be the go-to person for expertise related to this area, therefore a positive attitude and understanding of different perspectives combined with balancing stakeholders is important. This together with the willingness to coach and support to contribute to organizational development. Besides that, you are willing to take “hands-on” tasks and are good at planning your work accordingly. With your great experience combined with the ability to come up with new ideas, you will be able to bring this role to the necessary level.

  

  

**Want to know more? We hope so**

  

  

We’re excited to receive and review your application. Kindly apply for this position through our jobs portal, enclosing your CV in English by no later than **20th of September 2024**. We will not accept applications via email. Please note that selections will be running continuously so don’t delay with your application.

  

  

Welcome with your application!

  


**V****olvo Cars - Driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.

title: Systems Administrator III
description:
**Work Schedule**


Other**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**

**About Us**
------------


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, we are on a mission to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. With a team of over 100,000 colleagues, we are united by our common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, and Involvement. Together, we work tirelessly to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation, and support patients in need.

**How will you make an impact?**


As a Maintenance Responsible and Data Engineer for our Data Warehouse and Integration Platform, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth operation and continuous improvement of our systems. Your responsibilities will include:

**Data Engineer Duties:**


You will oversee data onboarding, manage the back-end development life-cycle including ETL processes, and ensure performance administration. You will design and manage the dimensional structure of tables within our data warehouse, create data definitions for new databases, and ensure data integrity and security. You will address and resolve database access and performance issues, and collaborate closely with business analysts, data scientists, and other data-focused roles to develop high-quality data products, ensuring data accuracy and quality.

**Maintenance Responsible Duties:**


You will develop and implement annual maintenance plans, lead and coordinate maintenance group activities, and conduct periodic system reviews. You will manage change orders and ensure all system and maintenance documentation is up to date. Additionally, you will review and manage access rights, monitor end-user system knowledge, and contribute to user acceptance testing and system enhancements.

**Requirements:**
-----------------

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Demonstrated experience in database management and data engineering
* Proficiency in Oracle and MS SQL Server
* Familiarity with Docker and MLFlow is highly advantageous
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a solid foundation in technical skills
* Experience in effectively coordinating with diverse teams


Join us in our ambitious journey and contribute to the seamless operation and advancement of our systems.

**Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com**

title: Data Engineer
description:
***Do you want to work with lots of data, use modern technology and join a passionate and fun team of individuals working in the streaming industry?***

***Do you want to be part of building a more data-driven and personalised user experience in one of Sweden's and Finland’s largest commercial media houses?***

The TV viewing patterns have changed with the transition from linear channel broadcasts to online streaming consumption, where users have become more active in choosing when, how and what content they watch. We in the data team want to leverage this new type of data to improve the experience of our customers. Some of our interests include

* personalised user experiences.
* enable targets advertising for online streaming.
* provision a centralised and modern data environment for analytics and various intelligence teams.


For achieving this, we work to identify, collect and harmonise vast amounts of data; ranging from user behaviour to content metadata.

**Does this sound like an exciting challenge?**


We are a Nordic team of data engineers, measurement engineers, ML-engineers and data scientists who have worked to build a rich data platform using modern technologies such as Amazon Web Services, Apache AirFlow, TensorFlow, Snowflake, Terraform, and more! We have freedom and responsibility to choose the solution according to the problem to be solved, such as data cleaning and transformation a vary of different incoming data sources.


We work together and iteratively develop our solutions and openly discuss different alternatives. We need to expand our Nordic data team with a driven data engineer who loves programming and new technology and has a passion for data pipelines. As a data engineer you will assume great ownership of the platform, develop batch and stream pipelines and architect data centric solutions with Amazon state of the art toolbox at your disposal. If you want to be part of our TV journey, come join us!

**Who are you?**


We believe that you are comfortable in Python and SQL and modern software development methods. You want to stay up to date on how the languages develop, and at the same time want to learn new skills and tools. You like challenges such as loading large amounts of data in a time-optimal and distributed way, handling data of unknown quality in a fail-safe way, secure processing and storage of sensitive data, or clever transformations that make data more useful. You like working in teams, both during the design, development and verification of a solution. If you already have knowledge of amazon web services and Snowflake to building data pipelines, that is a big plus!

**Who are we?**


TV Media is a business area within Telia Company that runs and develop TV content and the next generation TV solutions. Our consumer brands include TV4 Play, MTV Katsomo, tv4.se, MTV Uutiset, Fotbollskanalen.se and Köket.se. TV Media develops the best features and is an openminded technical organisation, all with full speed ahead.  

If you are interested in working with modern technologies, in a product with huge potential and being part of one of our passionate teams, then this is the place to be!

**About us**  

We bring all of Sweden together with our engaging news, great entertainment, live sports, and high-class drama series. TV4 Play and our other sites are visited by millions of people every day. Our content is the obvious choice both to enjoy on your own and together with others. Wherever and whenever you want.


TV4 stands on a foundation of independent journalism, our focus on our users and giving the whole of Sweden experiences to gather around.  

  

**Interested?**  

If you are interested in joining the team, apply for the job! If you want to learn more or have any questions, please reach out to me at josef.eriksson@tv4.se


Selection is ongoing, so do not hesitate to get in touch.


Required controls will be performed.

title: Senior Infrastructure Backend Java Engineer
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a** **Senior Infrastructure Backend Java Engineer**  

  

  

  

Are you prepared to thrive in the ever-evolving landscape of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a company on the rise, is ready to welcome you to your next exciting project as a **Senior Infrastructure Backend Java Engineer**. Come be a part of our journey!

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer that will join the team in our Platform mission that enables xx engineers to effectively utilize cloud infrastructure by providing a platform for infrastructure composition. Our declarative infrastructure is built on top of Kubernetes and we work closely with Google to make sure our platform scales with the growing number of managed resources at xx.

 **Keywords: Infrastructure as code, Golang, Java, Kubernetes, GKE**

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* As a team, we build a platform that enables infrastructure as code at xx, with the entire engineering organization as our users.
* The tech stack you’ll work on includes Kubernetes operators (typically in Golang); supporting backend services (in Java); utilities and scripts (in Python and Bash); analytics data pipelines (in Python and SQL); and a lot of declaratively managed infrastructure of our own (in YAML).
* Collaborate closely with our sister platform squads and become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team.
* We want you to bring your whole self to work and strive to foster an environment that supports your individual growth.

 **Requirements:**

* A valued team player in an autonomous, cross-functional team that inspires others experienced in designing, analyzing, optimizing code, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
* Experienced with Kubernetes, GKE, and Google Cloud Platform.
* Knowledgeable in how to write distributed, high-performance services and experienced in deploying and operating services on Linux.
* Passionate about infrastructure as code
* Can use scripting languages where needed to glue pieces together
* Have experience with Java and/or Go
* Equipped with a systematic problem-solving approach coupled with effective communication skills and drive.
* Excited about working on a team where you constantly learn, experiment, and iterate quickly.
 **Why Join Us?**



Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.


You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

 **#StockholmJobs #Hybrid #BackendEngineer #SeniorEngineer #InfrastructureAsCode #Golang #JavaDevelopment #Kubernetes #GKE #GoogleCloudPlatform #CloudInfrastructure #DevOps #TechJobs #EngineeringJobs #PlatformEngineering #DistributedSystems #HighPerformanceComputing #CI\_CD #CloudNative #Python #BashScripting #CrossFunctionalTeam #TechTalent #HiringNow #JobOpening #InnovativeTech #TechCareers #ApplyNow #JoinOurTeam #SoftwareEngineering #WorkFromAnywhere #GrowWithUs#vipasab#sweden**

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathi.hr@vipas.se &contact me at +46764341371/+46 739803973**

**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**

 **How to Apply:**


Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

  

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Software Engineer och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.  

  

**Vår ambitioner**  

Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.  

  

**Jobbeskrivning**  

* 4-6 years work experience
* Familiar with the BI area in general.
* Knowledge and experience of Teradata, Mainframe, ETL tools, (Informatica powercenter)
* Proven work with SQL Development
* Experience of agile framework (Safe) and agile way of working.
* Strong team player with ability to communicate, contribute and take decisions.
* Be curious to always learn and relentlessly find improvements.

  

**Location: Umeå or Stockholm**  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 22-09-2024 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.  

  

Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.


Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.  

  

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: DevOps / Backend Engineer
description:
**DevOps / Back-End Engineer**
------------------------------


Do you love being in the flow as a developer and want to enable that for everyone else as well? Do you believe that the key to personal flow is in making the local developer build experience fast, well-integrated, automated and with meaningful insights? We are seeking a collaborative and curious Engineer to help drive and develop our CI infrastructure forward.

  

Intro  

Continuous Integration (CI) is at the core of our developer experience. Spotify's growth and widespread prescense has led us to require an ever wider and deeper range of target platforms to run CI against. In a context where early adoption and swift flexibility is at utmost importance we need to provide CI environments that enables us to deliver functionality to our customers with both speed and safety. This role will be part of a team collaboratively creating and owning our CI infrastructure for Spotify which aims to provide our developers with a streamlined, simple to use and safe build experience at scale.  

The role is located in the Platform Developer Experience (PDX) studio within the Platform Mission. The PDX Studio oversees and owns the infrastructure that cuts across all engineering disciplines at Spotify.  

  

What you’ll do  

Execute on Spotify’s future CI infrastructure strategy that is able to serve 3000+ engineers doing 100’s of thousands of builds daily and beyond  

Support with Operational tasks keeping our systems healthy and uptodate  

Drive the automation and improvements of our CI system across our current technical stacks.  

Help scale our CI infrastructure to support large-scale monorepos.  

Collaborate with Infrastructure teams across the company to discover what a best in class CI infrastructure means.  

  

Who you are  

You are an experienced engineering familiar with Linux, MacOS, and Windows as well as Networking fundamentals  

You are an experienced Software Engineer with Java and Python  

You have experience deploying to and implementing solutions in GCP, Azure, and/or AWS.  

You believe in iteration and know that finding the right solution is more important than the first.  

You like to focus on standardization and automation; always looking for ways to improve the developer experience  

You have 6+ years of experience in building and implementing large-scale systems across various projects and teams  

You have familiarity with and enthusiasm for software engineering best practices such as testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery  

  

Skills  

Linux, MacOS, and Windows system administration experience  

HTTP / networking  

Google Cloud (preferred) / Azure / AWS  

Teamcity Integrations  

Ansible  

Java (Spotify’s standard programming tech stack)  

Python  

Docker  

Communication  

Written and verbal communication

 **Varmt välkommen att ansöka**


**Kontakt:**

  

Marjan Trajkovski


VD


marjan@crepido.com

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

title: Senior IT Arkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en IT Arkitekt och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.  

  

**Vår ambitioner**  

Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.  

  

**Jobbeskrivning**  

* föredra i IT-rådet/Arkitekturrådet för utlåtanden/beslut runt IT-stödet för ekonomiområdet
* utföra GAP-analys runt IT-stödet och ansvara för att roadmaps/livscykelplaner uppdateras
* ta fram lösningar inom området i samverkan med intressenter och leverantörer
* delta i riskanalyser och säkerhetsutvärderingar
* dela kunskap och kompetensöverföra till andra arkitekter
* samarbeta med övriga arkitekter i andra värdeströmmar

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete från större komplexa organisationer
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av koncernarkitektur med inriktning på ekonomisystem
* Har erfarenhet av arbete med teknisk kravställning samt IT-arkitektur avseende ekonomisystem
* Deltagit i lösning och införande av EA lösningar
* Kompetens kring ekonomisystem och betalflöden

  

**Meriterande**  

Det är meriterande om du har styrkt kompetens/certifieringar inom/av följande:  

  

Oracle eBusiness Suite  

Unit4 Business World  

Netcompany Solon Tax  

Andra ekonomisystem  

Sparx EA  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 16-09-2024 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.  

  

Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.


Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.  

  

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Senior Sektionschef
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Sektionschef och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.  

  

**Vår ambitioner**  

Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.  

  

**Jobbeskrivning**  

Som chef och ledare ser du till helheten, skapar förutsättningar och agerar medvetet i vardagen. I ditt ledarskap möjliggör du utveckling och lärande genom att ge mandat och skapa stort handlingsutrymme; du förstärker och följer upp de beteenden och den kultur som behövs för att vi tillsammans ska kunna genomföra vårt uppdrag. Du förväntas agera och leda även om svaren inte är givna, vägvalen inte tydliga och arbetssätten inte självklara. Med mod och insikt utmanar du våra invanda tankesätt och arbetssätt och är själv öppen för att låta dig utmanas.  

Du är linjechef för en personalgrupp inom IT-utvecklingsenhet på it-avdelningen som utvecklar och förvaltar samhällsviktigt systemstöd. Du har personalansvar för ett 20 tal medarbetare och konsulter och ingår i enhetens ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till enhetschefen. Här använder vi det agila ramverket SAFe och som linjechef förväntas du stötta tågledningen och hjälpa till att skapa de bästa förutsättningarna för tågets leveranser. Du bidrar till att kontinuerligt utveckla styrningen och de strukturer som bygger upp leveransförmågan.
  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* 8 års aktuell erfarenhet att som chef leda och utveckla en it verksamhet, dess organisation och medarbetare där det ingått prognosarbete och budgetansvar.
* En akademisk utbildning inom it/datavetenskap eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som relevant för befattningen
* Erfarenhet inom systemutveckling och en mycket god förståelse för hantverket samt kunskap om arbetssätt och metoder inom systemutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att rekrytera och leda medarbetare och konsulter med hög tekniskt kompetens
* Erfarenhet inom it-utveckling i en agil organisation

  

**Meriterande**  

* Aktuell chefserfarenhet från stora och komplexa företag/myndigheter med minst 8000 anställda
* Erfarenhet av att arbete med utveckling av system i säkerhetsklass.
* Erfarenhet av affärsrelationer som baseras på avtal
* Erfarenhet av det agila ramverket SAFe.
