title: System Test Engineer to Excillum!
description:
Do you want to work with the company behind the world´s brightest X-ray source? Great, then you´ve come to the right place! Excillum is a leading company in the field of high-end microfocus and nanofocus X-ray sources and was founded in 2007 by researchers from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH). As a System Test Engineer at Excillum, you will be part of a company with a friendly and helpful work environment with humble and motivated colleagues, who all contribute to enable new science, improve medicine and enhance manufacturing by continuous development of state-of-the-art X-ray sources.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Kista
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Excillum designs, develops, and manufactures X-ray sources with the world's highest brightness and with the world’s smallest spot depending on which product line you look at. The X-ray sources are used in a wide range of areas including quality assurance in semiconductors, electronics, and battery manufacturing. Other application areas are in the development of new medicine and research for example in biology, medicine, and material science. Since the start in 2007, Excillum has grown and today we are around 80 employees in Stockholm. You will be part of a growing international company with customers all over the world and you will play an important role in the work verifying our sources. Excillum is characterized by a strong engineering culture and except from your team, you will collaborate with experts in, for example, electronics, software, research, production and sales. Excillum site is in Kista with both lab and production in-house, which means that you will work close to the products you are developing.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to grow with the company
  
* The opportunity to influence working methods and share your knowledge
  
* A company with a friendly and helpful work culture where we listen to each other
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will part of the newly established System & Test group at Excillum, meaning you will play an important role in building up this position and help Excillum create a vision and strategy for their testing. The goal of the role is dual; both to ensure the design of new products and that they can be tested systematically in production. This includes understanding customer demands, the current test set-up and identifying a strategy to meet customer expectations. As Excillum is a small company this is a broad role where you are encouraged to take overall responsibility and dive into a range of tasks which could include different types of test, review of manuals or customer interactions.
 


  


 You will for example...
 


  

  
* Work in cross-functional projects collaborating with different engineering disciplines as well as product management, service and production.
  
* Conduct hands-on testing, analyze results and together with the team come up with improvements.
  
* Create and implement the production line with appropriate tests.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 For this position, and at Excillum in general, we attach great importance to you as a person and your interest for the position and the company. We believe in the right attitude!
 


  


 Since this is an important role at Excillum, you also need…
 


  

  
* A bachelor or master’s degree within electronics, mechatronics, physics or similar
  
* Several years of work experience with test of industrial products containing both hardware and software
  
* Knowledge in different types of tests
  
* Experience of automated testing. Able to set up automatic test environment and write tests
  
* Experience from production test
  
* Strong knowledge in English
  


  


  

**Other information**



  

  
* Start: Immediate, but an eventual notice period or other circumstances will be considered
  
* Work extent: Fulltime
  
* Location: Kista in Stockholm, Sweden
  
* This recruitment process is conducted by Academic Work. It is a request from Excillum that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.
  
* Contact information: Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Our selection process is ongoing and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Excillum on their website: https://www.excillum.com/
   




**Get directly recruited to Excillum Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Johanna Sörell or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106268

title: Junior Planner to H&M Assortment- Pipeline
description:
****Job Description****
**Do you want to be part of creating the best customer offer, driving profitable growth and strengthening our global, regional, and local customer experience? Are you looking for a role where your analysis and actions really make a difference? Then this is the opportunity for you!**
  

  

 H&M Assortment is a dynamic international workplace where high pace and rapid changes are natural parts of our day. This is where we design and develop our fashion collections for a wide variety of customers all over the world. H&M Assortment is divided into four
 **Customer Groups** 
 (Ladies, Menswear, Kids, and Lifestyle Brands including HOME, MOVE and BEAUTY) where we work cross-functional in diverse teams to create H&M’s best customer offer and experience – making it possible for everyone to look and feel good in a sustainable way.
   

  

****Job Description****
 In this role you work in close collaboration with your product team including pattern makers, designers and product developers, in one of the customer groups. You will also work in cross functional collaboration with sales regions, other product teams and functions within H&M to secure the best customer offer.
   

  

 You will constantly follow, react and identify new sales opportunities based on selling, customer insights and surrounding analysis. Together with your product team you will secure that our global assortment is locally relevant and optimized for each region. Your work closely with a planner to analyze the selling data and optimize the assortment planning and quantification on your category for example; shirts, pants, knitwear and more.
   

  

 Based on the assortment strategy of your category you will together with the product and planner team drive the income strategy as well as make the right quantification in order to maximize growth and profitability on the category you work for.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Daily you will collaborate closely with the planners in your team. You will optimize and quantify the products on your category in order to reach omni profitable growth, short and long-term.
* You will analyze the selling data on your product category on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis and take relevant actions by sharing your findings with your product team.
* You optimize the quantification of your products and you make decisions on whether to increase or decrease your selling forecasts, depending on selling outcome and future stock prognosis.
* You work closely with your product team to support their product decisions with your analysis of various KPI’s connected to selling, buying and stock planning.
* In close collaboration with our production offices you as a junior planner have the responsibility of placing orders in the right time to ensure that the products reach our physical and digital stores in the right time, in the right quantity and to the right part of the world.


****Qualifications****
 You are a person with a sense of salesmanship and strong analytical skills. You believe in collaboration, flexibility and thrive in a constantly changing environment. You have a self-going personality with a strong sense of responsibility and like to take on new challenges and take your own initiatives. You have a genuine passion for our products, growing business and achieving results. You are solution oriented and triggered by problem-solving and decision-making.
   

  

 As a person, we believe you are a communicative and engaging team player full of drive and optimism seeking opportunities and striving for constant improvements.
   

  

**What you need to be successful:**
* A higher degree within Business Administration, Buying or other relevant areas
* A strong sense of salesmanship and the ability to see opportunities for growth and profitability
* Strong analytical & numerical skills and the ability turn analysis into action
* The ability to be an informal leader who influences and coaches team members and leads by example
* Good knowledge in Excel and other analytical systems and tools
* Great communication skills
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal
* A great interest in fashion
* Experience as a Planner, Buyer, Merchandiser or Controller is meritorious


****Additional Information****
 This is a pipeline job - this means that there may be a delay in the response and that you could be put in the pipeline for future roles.
   

  

 This position is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden. You don’t have to live in Sweden already, we welcome applications from all parts of the world and offer relocation support if needed. Apply by sending in your CV in English.
   

  

****Benefits****
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

****Company Description****
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here

title: Senior IT-Controller
description:
*Länsförsäkringar AB söker nu en senior IT-controller med erfarenhet av att driva förändring och realisera effekter. Är du sugen på att bidra för att ta detta till nästa nivå? Då kan du vara den vi söker!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som senior IT-controller kommer du verka strategiskt tvärs över Länsförsäkringar AB-koncernen. Du kommer att bidra till en kvalitativ och kostnadseffektiv styrning av våra IT-kostnader och vara drivande i utvecklingen av finansiell styrning, analys och rapportering av dessa. Du utgår från Finansiell styrning och control inom Ekonomi & Finans men dina kontaktytor spänner tvärs över koncernen med extra fokus på enheten Digital och IT. Du rapporterar till Chef för Finansiell styrning och control.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter och ansvar är bland annat:
   

  

* Analysera och verka proaktivt kring IT-kostnader och investeringar inom Länsförsäkringar AB-koncernen för att identifiera möjligheter till ekonomisk effektivitet och utveckla processer för kostnadskontroll.
* Leverera tydliga och insiktsfulla finansiella rapporter och analyser till ledningen och andra intressenter för att stödja strategiska beslut.
* Samarbeta tätt med den centrala IT-enheten och andra delar av koncernen för att optimera resursanvändning och förbättra ekonomiska resultat genom ekonomisk rådgivning och analys.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer att göra dig framgångsrik för denna tjänst:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk examen.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IT-controlling.
* Vana att arbeta direkt mot ledningsgrupper i större verksamheter.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa ekonomiska data.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i ekonomisystem och avancerad användning av Excel.


 Certifiering inom exempelvis SAFe är starkt meriterande.
   

  

 Som person har du en stark analytisk förmåga och utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga, vilket gör att du kan förklara komplex ekonomisk information på ett begripligt sätt. Du är självgående och kan arbeta självständigt, men du trivs också med att vara en del av ett större sammanhang och samarbeta med andra för att nå gemensamma mål.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en strategisk och inflytelserik roll i ett företag där arbetsglädje står i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med några av branschens mest innovativa projekt och lösningar. Vi värdesätter en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsmiljö, där du omges av engagerade och stöttande kollegor. Vår dynamiska verksamhet präglas av drivna och glada medarbetare, vilket skapar en positiv och framåtblickande arbetsplats.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-30**

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga nätverkstekniker som är redo att ta sig an uppdrag för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill följa med på en spännande resa framåt och få möjligheten att växa med ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom den svenska IT-marknaden. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt och uppdrag, vi utlovar inspirerande arbetsuppgifter och utveckling.
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av en konsultgrupp med olika specialiteter för att kunna ge våra kunder den bästa leveransen och bred service. Du kommer att få delta i spännande och stimulerande samarbeten med kollegor på CGI och medarbetare hos våra kunder. På CGI kan du alltid lita på att det finns en kollega redo att stötta och hjälpa dig när du behöver det.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du som konsult för våra kunder som behöver din expertis inom nätverk. Våra kunder är stora företag eller organisationer inom offentlig sekor. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande, men sträcker sig från daglig drift till uppbyggnad av nya nätverksmiljöer.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du bland annat att arbeta med:
   

  

* Routrar, switchar, brandväggar, nätverksnära tjänster
* Hantera stödsystem för nätverket
* Projekt och integrering av kunders IT-miljö och andra kundprojekt/uppdrag
* Hantera beställningar, förändringar och felsökning i kundens driftmiljö
* Arbeta med att öka graden av automation


 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund, på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, det beror på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter har en hybridlösning, där det går att varva att vara på plats hos kund och jobba hemma.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som har en vilja att utvecklas och ta till dig nya kunskaper. Du ser möjligheter till lösningar hellre än problem. Vi ser gärna att du tycker om att samarbeta och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper men att du även har ett driv att själv utvecklas och växa både som individ och tillsammans med andra. Som konsult är det viktigt att man är flexibel och inte rädd för att möta och samarbeta med nya personer.
   

  

**Du bör ha erfarenhet och kunskap inom dessa områden**
* Du har erfarenhet inom Cisco och IT-drift antingen genom dina eftergymnasiala IT-utbildning alternativt har du förskaffat dig erfarenheten genom din arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Cisco-miljöer (meriterande med CCNA/CCNP-certifiering)
* Routing till komplexa routingmiljöer med dynamiska routingprotokoll
* Lastbalanserare (F5)
* Wireless
* Brandväggar


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där vi gärna ser att du är nyfiken, engagerad och har en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga, en positiv inställning samt trivs med att arbeta med stort kundfokus. Du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:**
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Övrigt**
 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Cisco Collaboration Engineer
description:
Position Summary:
   

  

 The Cisco Collaboration Engineer’s role within IT Service Delivery is to plan, design, build, install, configure, manage, secure, document, and support the systems within Data Center, Distribution Center, Public and Private Cloud environments, providing resilient, and scalable IT Services to support a fast-growing company.
   

  

 This role will be focused on the Cisco voice infrastructure, and will be responsible for developing, implementing, and documenting best practices and standards aimed at optimizing the VOIP infrastructure. The Collaboration Engineer will provide technical expertise, with ability to work on multiple projects and issues simultaneously, focusing on operational excellence and continuous improvement activities for Global IT Operations through ITIL based IT Service Management processes and procedures.
   

  

 The successful candidate must have excellent customer service, written, and verbal communication skills, and must be able to work collaboratively across multiple departments, business partners, and suppliers to meet operational performance and reliability targets. This role is critical in ensuring we collectively achieve our IT collaboration strategy: Enabling business & employee success through IT services that anticipate demand and simply work, anywhere, anytime.
   

  

 Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
   

  

* Provide end to end ownership and accountability for the service delivery, maintenance, and support of the global VOIP infrastructure of Client, and performance of the managed service provider(s).
* Managing telephony migrations from on-premise CUCM into Cisco Cloud (Webex Calling).
* Design, build, manage, optimize, support, and maintain the Client Holdings global enterprise VOIP environment including, but not limited to: CUCM, SIP CUBE, Webex Calling and Contact Center.
* Based on industry-best standards, develop and maintain technical standards and system configuration documentation, physical and logical diagrams, knowledge base articles, and runbooks for the proper transition of services to external managed service providers.
* Responsible for software and hardware upgrades relating to the Cisco voice infrastructure, including EOL/EOS refresh as part of life cycle management, ongoing security patching and vulnerability remediation according to established standards.
* Proactively and reactively identify and remediate voice and video performance issues and act as escalation point to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Provide Tier 3 technical expertise and support relating to Cisco voice infrastructure, and act as escalation point for the IT Service Center to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to provide operational support as needed, which may include off hours.
* Adhere to and participate in the current and future IT Service Management processes including, but not limited to incident, problem, and change control procedures.
* Other projects or duties as assigned.


 Required Skills and Experience:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in any field and 1+ years working experience and proficiency with planning, designing, supporting, maintaining, and LAN/WAN/VoIP communications, network hardware such as Cisco routers, Ethernet switches, access points voice gateways & firewalls.
* OR 3+ years of on-the-job experience in these areas in lieu of bachelor’s degree.
* Experience with supporting technologies such as Cisco Voice technologies to include the following: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), Cisco Unity Connection (CUC), Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (CUCCX), Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence, and Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE), Cisco Expressway, Cisco Video System, and Webex Control Hub and suite.
* Experience with Voice related protocols (SIP, RTP/SRTP, SDP, MGCP, SCCP etc.); SIP/PSTN Design and Voice Gateway Configuration. Detailed knowledge and understanding of telephony/UC protocols, H323, SIP, T38, TLS and Codecs
* Familiar with technology such as: Wireless (WiFi) 802.11 a/b/g/n technologies, Network security/VPN/SSL technologies, such as Cisco, Palo Alto, Cisco Nexus platforms
* Knowledge of network architecture and maintenance, such as log analysis, backup/recovery, high availability, capacity planning, and DR/resiliency.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong technical support, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across teams in a high performing and matrixed team environment.


 Additional information
   

  

 The minimum gross wage according to the collective agreement (chemical industry) for your new job is EUR 3.909,67. We strive to adapt your salary to your range of tasks and to your profile, which is why we are ready to pay wages higher than collectively agreed. This is a legal requirement in Austria which is not applicable for other sites.

title: Data & Analytics Business Translator
description:
**Join Our Data & Analytics Team: Bridge the Gap Between Ideas and Action**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.  Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As D&A Business Translator, you will work with marketing domain business analysts and experts to understands the strategic needs of the business, identify & structure opportunities that can be solved through data, analytics and AI. You will translate these needs into possible new use cases in both business and technical language.
   

  

**Your Daily Challenges:**
* Analyze commercial, marketing performance, and consumer data.
* Elicit key information using document analysis, requirements, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
* Communicate and collaborate with teams to analyze information and functional requirements and deliver solutions from analytics artifacts to AI applications.
* Collaborate within a Product Team, working alongside architects, data & visualization engineers, data scientists, Product Owners, and marketing subject matter experts/business analysts.
* Establish the technical vision and evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance requirements.
* Aggregate existing data from Electrolux and external sources such as GA4, DV360, SA360, Meta, Qualtrics, eCommerce, and service systems.
* Transpose hypotheses and methodologies into relevant metrics and applications.
* Develop customized solutions with D&A Engineering and Data Science teams to link, store, locate, and retrieve data using the appropriate infrastructure and tools.


**You are:**
* Bi-lingual: You understand both business and technical languages and naturally act as a translation bridge between the two. You can explain technical concepts in business-friendly language and vice-versa. You support the business users during UATs.
* Excellent collaborator & communicator: You have a proven ability to form strong cross-functional relationships with varying business partners, promoting a strong sense of "we're all in it together."
* Data Analytics: You are a critical thinker who is enterprising, curious, persistent, and strategic, with significant experience in analysis work and using various analytics tools.
* Data driven: You leverage data naturally and drive optimization. You have a strong analytical mind with experience in coordinating analytics and data science projects and teams.
* Agile: You are familiar with working in agile teams, have a sense of urgency, and can quickly adapt to different situations, understanding changes, and reacting confidently and decisively. You have a demonstrated ability to learn quickly and a hunger for continual learning.


**Requirements:**
* Academic degree in (business) computer science or a comparable training
* Sound understanding of systems integration concepts
* Experience in analytics development and handling a wide range of analytical tools and applications (e.g. Power BI, Qlik products, SQL, Python, Databricks)
* Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills.
* Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment
* Ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Fluent in English, any other language is a plus


**The location:**
 This is a full-time position based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden). At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities under the same roof, and we enjoy the look and feel of the office. You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the common language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friends benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

title: Software Engineer III, Cloud Media Processing
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience with software development in C++, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree in an industry setting.
* 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.
* 2 years of experience with one or more of the following : Audio/video processing, server development; web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
* 2 years of experience with performance, large-scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, or debugging.
* Experience in software development using a general purpose programming language (e.g., C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript).
* Experience in machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, or similar.
* Proficiency in code and system health, diagnosis and resolution, and software test engineering.


**About The Job**
 Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
   

  

 With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
   

  

 The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
* Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
* Develop infrastructure that support Meet's need for cloud-side audio and video processing.
* Partner with feature and quality teams to support and incorporate new functionality.
* Support running Meet media servers in production.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: RMD-Developer/Administrators to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
We are looking for two RMD Developers/Administrators to join two exciting teams at one of Europes biggest banks! Do you want to specialize in databases and data management then this role is the perfect next step in your career. Apply now - we use ongoing selection due to startdate!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Kungsholmen
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term employment. Possibility to hybrid work, according to company policy
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As an RMD Developer/Administrator, you will be responsible for administrating relational database management systems (RMDS) and assisting in query writing. You will also work on ETL transformations and API integrations. With a focus on maintaining and managing data, you’ll support the specific System Team in delivering high-quality results in an agile, fast-paced environment.
   

**RMD stands for Reference Master Data.**



  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting role where you get the chance to grow and work with modern technologies as well as working at the largest financial group in the Nordic region and one of Europe's largest banks.
  
* You'll get the opportunity to join a global team of experts and work with senior colleagues, as well as increase your skills as a Database developer focusing on RDMS.
  
* The opportunity to develop and advance in your career. As well as working at a global company which value a sustainable workplace, work-life balance with remote work and a diverse workplace.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your career. This is a long term assignment at our client and you'll have an ongoing employment at Academic Work.
  

  


**Work tasks**

 In the role you will assist the team with database administration and writing queries and you will work with tools such as SQL, Oracle and Tibco. This is an exciting role for you who have a passion for database- and data management and want to learn more about it to become the expert in the team.
 


  

  
* Administer relational databases and manage queries.
  
* Assist in ETL transformations and API integrations.
  
* Collaborate with Scrum teams to deliver on milestones.
  
* Support the overall data management discipline within the organization.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / InformationTechnology
  
* Experience with databases as SQL, Oracle and/or Tibco
  
* Good understanding of data management practices.
  
* Fluent in English in both writing and speaking
  
* Has a Swedish citizenship or a valid long term work permit to start the position immediately.
   

 In the recruitment process, we will assess both personality and logic tests, and it is also mandatory to provide a background check - Belastningsregistret.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Familiarity with web services and Kafka
  
* Experience in Master Data Management and knowledge of RMDS (Relational Database Management System)
  
* Experience from the bank industry
  
* Proficent in Swedish
  


  


 Knowledge can be gained through education, experience or self-taught.
 


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Change oriented
  
* Communicative
  
* Responsible
  
* Intellectually curious
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Milla Olsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106783

title: Senior Quality Engineer
description:
Lifesum is a leading consumer health tech company that aims to simplify healthy living, helping over 60M users around the world improve their lives through healthier and sustainable habits.
   

  

 We are building a platform where we motivate and inspire our users to eat better with the help of delightful software.
   

  

 We are a hybrid global team headquartered in Stockholm, a team of passionate entrepreneurial individuals, working together to build something that truly matters. By working at Lifesum you get the chance to do something good and have a positive impact on millions, helping our users on their individual routes to look and feel better every day. Expanding our team with the right competencies and ambitious people will help us increase what value we provide to people on a global scale. We are now looking for an Senior Quality Engineer to join our team.
   

  

 What you will be working on at Lifesum
   

  

 We are seeking a Senior QA Automation Engineer to enhance our Engineering Team’s efforts in delivering high-quality software. In this vital role, you’ll lead the quality assurance lifecycle within our Agile process, ensuring timely releases.
   

  

 You’ll design and coordinate test strategies, develop and maintain our mobile test automation frameworks, and execute comprehensive tests.You will be engaged throughout the full development process of our products, working closely together with colleagues in development and product. Your expertise will be crucial in driving our continuous integration flows, troubleshooting system issues, and maintaining the highest standards of quality assurance for our products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive the software quality assurance lifecycle within Agile methodologies
* Design, implement, and coordinate test strategies and plans with development/product teams
* Contribute to the maintenance and enhancement of mobile test automation frameworks
* Develop and execute automated UI and functional tests on real devices and emulators
* Review daily test results, report and track issues


 Your experience will be a valuable asset
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development or QA automation
* Proficiency in mobile/web application testing
* Experience from Mobile app testing (iOS and Android) is a must
* Comfortable using GitHub, and experienced with CI tools , and test management tools like JIRA
* Communicative and collaborative
* Fluent in spoken and written English
* Relevant academic degree


 We are just getting started
   

  

 Our mobile apps have more than 60 million registered users worldwide, but our journey in building the worlds leading nutritional platform has just started. We have the foundation to do better and more. Together we are One Team of talented individuals with solution-oriented 'can do' mindset and work to constantly improve the experience of Lifesum. We also not only embrace diversity, but we rely on it to succeed. That’s why we work hard to ensure our team, vendors, and partners are representative of the millions of users we serve.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

* Trust and responsibility in a fast-paced environment
* Opportunity to work on a range of exciting projects with some of the most successful companies in the world
* Space and support do develop and grow your career
* 30 paid vacation days per year
* Parental pay
* Pension
* Private health and medical insurance
* Individual training and development budget
* Wellness allowance
* Flexible work
* Great team activities


 If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you and get to know you. Send us your resume right away; tell us why you are interested and why Lifesum feels like the right place for you. Everyone is welcome; we look forward to your application!
   

  

 Lifesum is one of the fastest-growing global digital health companies. Our product aims to simplify the path to long-term healthy eating, and our technology motivates users to live a more balanced lifestyle with personalized plans for better and healthier eating.
 **Life** 
 is the
 **sum** 
 of everything you do.

title: Data Analyst DORA
description:
We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to join the team responsible for the Digital Operational Resilience Act (“DORA”) implementation for our customers from the banking industry.
 



 The team's responsibilities will span across several key areas, including the collection of business and functional requirements, including the sourcing, mapping, profiling, and modeling of data, as well as the development of a data hub/repository. Furthermore, the team will be tasked with creating an automated ETL process and a reporting engine and mechanism to comply with DORA requirements.
 



 Joining Sii Sweden means gaining access to the perks of a seasoned IT consulting company. From training sessions and webinars to collaborative knowledge-sharing sessions with colleagues, we offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes insurance, pension plans, and wellness benefits. Thrive in our stable and forward-thinking environment, where your growth and success are our priorities.
 



 We can't wait to have you on board!
 



  





**Your role:** 



* Build the register of information at the entity, sub-consolidated, and consolidated level by the Digital Operational Resilience Act
* Gather data from various sources, create data models, design and write ETL scripts, and generate detailed reports
* Implement technical standards on the standard templates for the information register related to all contractual arrangements for the use of ICT services
* Plan and schedule interviews with clients’ Application Owners and Providers to identify DORA data needs
* Analyze DORA Data Requirements
* Proactively plan and drive the requirement work with ROI key stakeholders, future ROI application owners, and providers
* Design Use Cases



  





**Your skills:** 



* Proficiency in Python and/or R for data analysis and visualization
* Previous work with designing and writing ETL scripts
* Strong knowledge of SQL for querying and managing databases
* Experience with tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView
* Expertise in cleaning, transforming, and preparing data for analysis
* Familiarity with DORA regulations
* Experience working effectively within cross-functional teams

title: Cloud & Backend Specialist with SQL experience
description:
**About us:** 




 We’re a growing startup with a track record of building successful products, and we’re looking for someone who’s ready to join us on this exciting journey. Our team is a mix of app developers, embedded engineers, frontend & backend developers, and we’re working together to create innovative solutions. Now, we need a
 **Cloud/Backend Specialist with excellent SQL skills** 
 who can help us ensure our databases are fast, reliable, and ready to scale!
 



  





 If you’re passionate about databases, cloud infrastructure, and backend development, this role is for you!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




**Manage SQL Databases:** 
 You’ll take ownership of our
 **SQL databases** 
 , ensuring high availability, strong performance, and robust backup strategies.
 



**Optimize Database Performance:** 
 You’ll keep an eye on database health and performance, optimizing queries, indexes, and overall architecture to ensure we’re always running smoothly.
 



**Backups & Disaster Recovery:** 
 Develop and maintain
 **backup plans** 
 ,
 **disaster recovery strategies** 
 , and ensure we’re prepared for any unforeseen events.
 



**Cloud Infrastructure (AWS):** 
 You’ll be managing our databases on
 **AWS** 
 , working with cloud services to ensure reliability and scalability. Familiarity with other cloud platforms like Azure is a plus, but not required.
 



**API Development:** 
 Contribute to
 **API development** 
 using
 **Python** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 , or
 **JavaScript** 
 , integrating database functionality with our existing backend systems.
 



**Collaboration:** 
 You’ll work closely with our cross-functional team of developers (frontend, backend, and embedded) to ensure that database solutions fit seamlessly into our broader system architecture.
 



**Documentation:** 
 Maintain clear and thorough documentation to ensure all configurations, processes, and updates are easily accessible to the team.
 



  





**What we are looking for:** 




**5+ years of SQL experience** 
 – You have deep knowledge of database management, including backups, high availability, and performance tuning.
 



**AWS expertise** 
 – You know your way around
 **AWS services** 
 (EC2, RDS, S3) and are comfortable managing databases in the cloud.
 



**Strong Linux skills** 
 – You’re confident working in a
 **Linux environment** 
 and have the know-how to keep things running smoothly.
 



**Programming experience** 
 – Proficiency in
 **Python** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 , or
 **JavaScript** 
 to support API development and database-related tasks.
 



**Understanding of APIs and microservices** 
 – You’ve worked with APIs and know how to integrate databases into larger systems. Familiarity with
 **microservices architecture** 
 is a plus.
 



**NoSQL knowledge** 
 is a bonus, but not a must-have.
 



**Team player** 
 – You’re comfortable working in a collaborative environment and can work across different teams to get things done.
 



**Self-starter** 
 – You’re proactive and can take ownership of projects with minimal supervision.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




**Startup environment** 
 – You’ll be part of a growing company with a flat structure and opportunities to make a real impact.
 



**Exciting projects** 
 – Work on innovative, real-world products with a team that’s passionate about what they do.
 



**Onsite with flexibility** 
 – While we prefer working together onsite, we offer some remote flexibility for when you need it.
 



**Opportunities for growth** 
 – As we grow, so will you. There are plenty of opportunities to advance your career and expand your skillset.
 



**Collaborative culture** 
 – You’ll be working alongside talented and supportive colleagues who value open communication and knowledge sharing.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Burger King Sweden and Denmark is a leading name in the QSR industry, known for our dedication to innovation and customer service. As we continue to grow, we are expanding our Digital team to support our evolving business needs in both markets.
 



  





***Awesome! But what will my new role be?***




  





**About the role** 




  





 We are looking for a Marketing Coordinator to join our dynamic team, located in Sweden. In this role, you will manage digital content across multiple platforms, coordinate marketing campaigns, and support product launches. You’ll ensure our digital channels, including kiosks, websites, and delivery platforms, are up-to-date and aligned with our brand goals. Your work will be essential in shaping the guest experience and driving our digital transformation in both Sweden and Denmark.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Keep Master Sheets updated for kiosk systems and delivery platforms (Wolt, Foodora, Uber Eats).
* Prepare and send briefs to POS systems (Acrelec, Future Ordering), including master files and images.
* Ensure consistency across platforms by updating final files in Mediaflow.
* Work with delivery platforms to provide accurate content and images.
* Perform quality checks on kiosk setups in test environments to ensure everything works properly.
* Update the website with product details and availability.
* Manage the marketing inbox, responding to inquiries promptly.
* Launch content and campaigns on digital platforms like kiosks, websites, and apps.
* Handle product documentation and ensure it reaches the IT team on time.
* Oversee coupon roll-outs and testing for smooth implementation.
* Submit Master Data System documentation for product launches.
* Assist in submitting product operations guides for store use.
* Assist with ad hoc marketing administrative tasks as needed.



  





**Requirements** 




  




* Recent graduate with a Bachelor's/Master's degree in Marketing, Communications or similar.
* Basic knowledge of marketing concepts, particularly in digital content management and coordination.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
* Ability to learn quickly and manage digital marketing channels and content updates.
* Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Fluency in Swedish is required, and basic knowledge of Danish is a plus.
* Familiarity with platforms like Acrelec, Future Ordering, Wolt, Foodora, and Uber Eats is advantageous but not required.



  





**What we offer** 




  




* A fantastic career opportunity within a leading international brand.
* The opportunity to shape and develop your role within a dynamic, growing team.
* Competitive salary package.
* A flexible work environment, with the position based in Sweden.
* The chance to be part of a team that is passionate about delivering great guest experiences.



  





**Application Process** 




  





 If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please submit your resume via the "Apply" button on this page. For any questions regarding the job opportunity, feel free to contact Patrisia Kostadinova at Patrisia.Kostadinova@Kingfood.dk for more information.

title: Systemingenjör med inriktning Försvarsmaktens radiosystem
description:
Försvarsmaktens Telekommunikations- och informationssystemförband, FMTIS, söker nu dig som har ett stort teknikintresse och vill fortsätta utveckla dina kunskaper inom ett spännande och viktigt område med förvaltningsledning inom Försvarsmaktens radiosystem.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 FMTIS har ett samlat ansvar för drift, underhåll och förvaltning av Försvarsmaktens tekniska ledningsstödsystem. Systemen stödjer militära insatser till sjöss, på land och i luften – i Sverige och utomlands. Vårt ansvar omfattar hela kedjan, från anläggningar och transmissions- och bärarnät till applikationer, servrar, datorer och radiosystem. Arbetet sker på strategisk, operativ och taktisk nivå.
   

  

 Systemenheten ansvarar för förvaltning av teknik och materiel i Försvarsmaktens fasta ledningsstödsystem, teknisk och infrastrukturell design samt arkitektur av den försvarsmaktsgemensamma informationsinfrastrukturen. Systemenheten består av en enhets ledning, stab och tre avdelningar omfattandes totalt ca 200 medarbetare fördelade på ca 15 orter i Sverige.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Systemingenjör tillhör du Systemenhetens vidmakthållandeavdelning där du kommer att arbeta med övergripande teknisk förvaltning och vara sammanhållande med att leda, planera och inrikta systemförvaltningen av Försvarsmaktens Marina radiosystem.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetet innebär att:
   

  

* Vara delaktig i uppdragsdialogen och samverka direkt mot vår uppdragsgivare avseende ekonomi och målsättningar.
* Följa den tekniska utvecklingen inom området och stödja arbetet kring uppdateringar för att radiosystemen ska hålla tillräckligt hög säkerhet.
* Stödja pågående utvecklingsprojekt av nya radiosystem- och produkter samtidigt som du förvaltar befintliga system och produkter.


 Huvuduppgiften är inte att arbeta direkt med tekniken utan fokus ligger på ledning av förvaltningen och de resurser som finns inom organisationen. Du måste ha en teknisk förståelse och en grundläggande teknisk kompetens för att få specialister med djup teknisk kunskap att använda sina kunskaper i rätt riktning.
   

  

 Som systemingenjör kommer du att arbeta i miljöer som erbjuder möjlighet till nära samarbete och erfarenhetsutbyte med övriga kollegor och myndigheter varvid hög social förmåga och flexibilitet krävs.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Verksamheten erbjuder stor variation och komplexitet. Våra anställda har ett flertal olika förmåner, bla:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling utifrån verksamhetens behov och dina karriärsmål.
* Tre timmars träning i veckan på arbetstid och ersättning för träningsskor.
* Flexibel arbetstid samt 28 - 35 semesterdagar beroende på din ålder.
* Lönetillägg vid föräldraledighet och VAB samt möjlighet att växla semesterdagar mot extra pensionsavsättning.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning med inriktning mot IT/Telekom, eller motsvarande aktuell erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig av arbetsgivaren.
* Erfarenhet av utvecklings- och förvaltningsarbete inom IT/Telekom/Radio.
* B-körkort.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med olika radiosystem.
* Erfarenhet av praktisk ledning, exempelvis som gruppledare eller motsvarande.
* Kännedom om ledningssystem och dess infrastruktur inom Försvarsmakten.
* Kontaktnät inom Försvarsmakten/ Industrin.
* Erfarenhet av Projektledning.
* Språkkunskaper i teknisk engelska.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens IT-infrastruktur.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som är engagerad och serviceinriktad, har lätt för att ta kontakt med människor och har god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift. Du är van att leda och engagera och har en stor personlig drivkraft. Du är en god lagkamrat samtidigt som du gärna tar initiativ och eget ansvar. Du har god administrativ förmåga.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Civil tillsvidareanställning. Försvarsmakten tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid
   

  

 Lön: Individuell lönesättning tillämpas. Ange löneanspråk i ansökan.
   

  

 Arbetsort: Berga
   

  

 Tjänsten medför resor både över dagen men också längre perioder.
   

  

 Tillträdesdatum: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 I Försvarsmakten benämns tjänsten Systemingenjör
   

  

 Upplysningar om befattningen
   

  

 Rekryterande chef:
   

  

 Sektionschef - Mikael Adolfsson (010-8232153)
   

  

 Anställningsvillkor:
   

  

 HR-Generalist: Sabina Packalén
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare:
   

  

 SACO Agnetha Landqvist
   

  

 OFR/S Martin Sparr
   

  

 SEKO Matz Felix
   

  

 OFR/O Heikki Videll
   

  

 Samtliga nås via växeln: 019-39 35 00, (Växel)
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Försvarsmaktens telekommunikations- och informationssystemförband, FMTIS, säkerställer Försvarsmaktens förmåga att kommunicera och leda - dygnet runt, året om. Förbandet har ett samlat ansvar för Försvarsmaktens tekniska ledningssystem som stödjer militära insatser till sjöss, på land och i luften – i Sverige och utomlands. Förbandet har över 1 800 medarbetare på mer än 30 orter runt om i landet. Läs mer på https://jobb.forsvarsmakten.se/fmtis En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras samt att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Säljare inom IT-infrastruktur till itm8
description:
Tillsammans med 14 nordiska IT-företag har vi bildat itm8, ett nytt nordeuropeiskt powerhouse inom digital transformation. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med, och dessutom ha en nyckelroll på resan. Hos oss är du med från start med att bygga och etablera itm8 på den svenska marknaden och mer specifikt inom försäljning och affärsutveckling inom databasområdet. Likt oss trivs du bäst i situationer där alla svar inte är givna, men du kommer att ta dig an att finna dem tillsammans med ambitiösa och drivna kollegor.
 



  





 Som Sales Specialist inom området Application Services driver du hela säljprocessen från lead till signerad affär och uppföljning. Application Services erbjuder managed services och rena konsulttjänster inom databasområdet under konceptet Powerhouse of Databases. Fokus ligger på Oracle, Microsoft, Postgres, MySQL och open source-databaser, där vi kan leverera tjänster och seniora konsulter. Förutom att du är kundens guide på en övergripande nivå inom databastekniska frågeställningar diskuterar ni även säkerhet, HA-lösningar, back-up, versionshantering och licensfrågor.
 



  





 Du kommer att ha ett stort fokus på cross-selling där du bearbetar befintliga kunder och visar möjligheterna med våra lösningar. Samtidigt bygger vi detta nya affärsområde i den nya organisationen, där du kommer ha stor möjlighet att påverka processer och samarbeten. Vid din sida finns presalespecialister, projektledare, förändringsledare och tekniska specialister som du jobbar nära för att skapa den bästa lösningen för kunden. Itm8:s Application Services har samlat mer databaskompetens än något annat bolag i Norden. Du är/blir på det viset en specialistsäljare men får också tillgång till hela itm8:s bredd som komplett IT-leverantör vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att lyckas och utvecklas i din roll.
 



  





  





**Dina kompetenser och erfarenhet** 




 Vi ser flera relevanta bakgrunder för rollen vi söker. Antingen har du säljerfarenhet från IT-branschen med fokus på molntjänster, infrastruktur, SW eller konsulttjänster, eller så har du mer teknisk erfarenhet från en support- eller specialistroll. Det viktigaste för oss är din nyfikenhet och driv att skapa resultat och skapa säkra, robusta lösningar för dina kunder.
 



 Du är en stark kommunikatör och nätverkare som gillar att omge dig med högt professionella kollegor där kundrelationen är det som driver oss varje dag.
 



  





**Creating the Difference – today, tomorrow, together** 




 itm8 är en av de ledande nordiska aktörerna inom managerade IT-tjänster för privata företag och den offentliga sektorn. Itm8 består idag av 14 företag som i en stor fusion under 2023 bildade ett powerhouse under varumärket itm8 med över 1800 specialister. Tillsammans säkerställer vi de bästa tjänsterna för att bli Nordens ledande digitala transformationspartner inom Cloud & Infrastructure, Digital Transformation, Cybersecurity och Application Services. itm8 finns representerat på 28 platser i Danmark, Sverige, Tyskland, Filippinerna och Tjeckien och omsatte över 4 miljarder 2023.
 



  





 Läs gärna mer om vår story, kultur och våra erbjudanden www.itm8.se. Du är också varmt välkommen att lära känna oss mer på Instagram @itm8inside.
 



  





  





**Redo att utmana(s) med itm8?** 




 Varmt välkommen att ansöka till tjänsten på vår karriärsida. Om du inte är redo att ansöka än och har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt. Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-09-30 och vi kontaktar kandidater löpande så vi rekommenderar att du ansöker till tjänsten så snart du kan.
 



  





 På itm8 är vi övertygade om att mångfald berikar oss och driver innovation framåt. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden av alla kön, bakgrunder och livserfarenheter. Hos oss hittar du en arbetsgivare som värdesätter och uppmuntrar unika perspektiv och idéer. Oavsett vem du är eller varifrån du kommer, om du delar vår passion för teknik och kundrelationer, vill vi höra från dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och chansen att möjligen välkomna dig till vårt team!

title: Tech Agent Program
description:
Är du trött på ditt nuvarande jobb och söker förändring? Är du intresserad av IT men osäker på hur du ska gå till väga för att byta bransch? Långa universitetsstudier kanske inte lockar dig, och inte heller ovissheten av att veta om det du studerar leder till direkt anställning.
   

  

 Idag är klivet in i IT-branschen alldeles för stort – det vill vi ändra på! Tech Agent Programmet är utformat för dig som vill arbeta inom IT efter att ha arbetat några år inom andra områden. Det är helt enkelt en intensiv 4-veckorsutbildning för dig som vill satsa på en ny karriär. Om du har viljan och siktet inställt på IT-branschen, vill vi vara din karriärpartner som hjälper dig att förverkliga dina drömmar.
   

  

*"Om man inte har jobbat inom IT tidigare och känner ett intresse, så är det en jättebra ingång. Det är en kort utbildning med garanterat jobb. Det är en bra möjlighet att få testa på branschen om man tycker att det verkar roligt."*
 – Axel Lind, tidigare Tech Agent som idag är inne på sitt andra uppdrag via Wise IT. Läs hela intervjun här: Axel bytte karriär på fyra veckor | Wise IT
   

  

**Om programmet**
 Tech Agent Program drivs i samarbete med Lexicon IT-proffs, ett ledande utbildningsföretag. Utbildningen pågår under 4 veckor på plats i Lexicons lokaler och vårt kontor. Den varvas med teori, labbar och självstudier. Wise IT bekostar utbildningen.
   

  

**Vad händer efter utbildningen?**
 Vi garanterar alla som tar examen en anställning som tar vid när programmet är slut. Placeringen för anställningen kommer primärt vara i Stockholm, men möjlighet finns även i Göteborg. Utbildningen är intensiv, så du bör inte vara rädd för att ta dig an en utmaning när du söker.
   

  

**Vem kan söka till Tech Agent Program?**
 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet, varav minst 1 års serviceerfarenhet.
* Obehindrat språkbruk i både svenska och engelska, både i skrift och tal.
* Intresse i teknik för att kunna tillgodogöra dig kursinnehållet på bästa sätt.
* Möjlighet att vara på plats i Stockholm under utbildningstiden (4 veckor kl: 8-17).


 Meriterande är om du:
   

  

* Har arbetat med kundtjänst.
* Har telefonvana.
* Har gått IT-gymnasiet eller har en annan koppling till IT.


**Inkludera en kort motivering i din ansökan om varför du vill delta i vårt Tech Agent Program och vad som lockar dig till denna möjlighet.**
 För att du ska trivas i rollen ser vi att du har ett genuint IT-intresse. Som person är du driven, lojal och lösningsorienterad. Du motiveras av tanken att jobba som konsult, lära dig mycket på kort tid och ha ett mål att utvecklas inom IT.
   

  

**Kursinnehåll**
 Läs om kursinnehållet här: Tech Agent Program | Wise IT
   

  

**Villkor**
 Nästa omgång startar 23 september. Vi på Wise IT vill underlätta för fler människor att öppna upp sina ögon för en karriär inom IT, och därför står vi för hela utbildningskostnaden. Det enda vi begär av dig är full närvaro och engagemang i programmet. Vi garanterar även en anställning som konsult hos oss när du är klar med utbildningen, under förutsättning att du blir godkänd och får ditt examensbevis.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Marina Malesevic (marina.malesevic@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi arbetar enligt löpande urval.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan! 🌻

title: Supportspecialist till mediekoncern
description:
**Rollen**
 Vi söker en driven och erfaren IT-support tekniker för att stärka teamet hos vår kund som är en ledande medieaktör. Som en nyckelroll i organisationen kommer du att vara ansvarig för att tillhandahålla teknisk support av hög kvalitet till deras användare i en modern IT-miljö. Kontoret ligger i Stockholms innerstad.
   

  

**Om dig**
* Du är väl bevandrad i felsökning av olika system som MS Office 365, Active Directory och Azure,.
* Du har även erfarenhet av att stödja både Mac- och Windows-miljöer samt kunskap om Intune.
* Du har en mycket positiv attityd och brinner för att lösa problem och leverera utmärkt service till våra användare.
* Du trivs både med att arbeta självständigt och som en del av ett mångsidigt team.
* Din förmåga att kommunicera effektivt och samarbeta med människor från olika bakgrunder är avgörande för denna roll.
* Flytande i både svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, är ett krav för denna roll.


 Om du är redo för en spännande utmaning i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan utvecklas och växa som professionell, så är detta din chans att göra skillnad. Ansök nu för att ta nästa steg i din karriär som en del av vårt dedikerade team!
   

  

 PASSAR VI DIG?
   

  

 Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Marina Malesevic på marina.malesevic@wiseit.se. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 🌻

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Sinch is a global leader in the growing market for Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. We are specialists in allowing businesses to reach everyone on the planet, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 With presence in more than 50 countries, whether you know us or not, you've definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.
   

  

 Sinch's core values are Make it Happen, Dream Big, Keep it Simple and Win Together. These values describe how our global organization works and inspire every of our more than 3,000 employees across 55 different countries.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Role and Responsibilities**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

 Tech Stack: NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Please apply your resume in English!**
**In Order To Contribute To This Role, You Have**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Big Plus!**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Benefits**
 Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently work towards identifying the candidates that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.
   

  

 We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new ideas and perspectives to Sinch!e

title: Modern Workplace Engineer | Microsoft 365
description:
Unlock the potential of Microsoft 365 as a visionary engineer, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions. Embrace continuous learning and collaborate with global teams to shape the future of technology-driven excellence. Join us at Avanade, where creativity, innovation, and career growth thrive.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Are you passionate about helping partners realize the value of a Modern Workplace? So are we!
   

  

 Avanade Sweden is looking for a Modern Workplace Engineer who will use their experience in Microsoft 365 suite including collaboration, device management, and security components to provide a truly cost-efficient, responsive, and secure evergreen Modern Workplace to our valued clients. You thrive on transforming business challenges into powerful solutions, and your attention to detail sets you apart. Embrace your passion for continuous learning and seize the opportunity to deliver top-tier results under pressure. Join us as we shape the future with technology-driven excellence!
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Skills And Experiences**
 You have previous experience with:
   

  

* Microsoft 365
* Collaboration tools such as SharePoint online, Teams
* Modern Device management with Intune/SCCM
* Understanding of security components in Entra ID, Purview and Defender suite
* Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop
* Windows 11 and mobile operating systems


 Office 365
   

  

* Other experience includes:
* PowerShell and other scripting language
* Up-to-date knowledge of Microsoft products


**About You**
 You’re a natural communicator who wants to help our partners on their Modern Workplace journey. You will help improve employee mobility, efficiency, teamwork, and security demonstrating your experience in Microsoft 365 suite. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge.
* Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication.
* Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions.
* Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements


**What You'll Do**
 As a
 *Modern Workplace Engineer* 
 , your focus is on Workplace Services including desktop solutions, collaboration technologies, Voice solutions and enablement of secure remote working environments.
   

  

 Day-to-day, you will make upgrades, migrations, and evergreen scenarios. You translate business requirements into technical solutions using Microsoft 365 products, driving their implementations in enterprise environments. You collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions, manage task backlog for continuous improvement and share best-practices with Global Avanade Team members. Additionally, you apply your expertise in technical and consulting knowledge to advise clients on accurate governance to ensure stability, and to enable them to evolve their environments to support changing business requirements.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our Modern Workplace team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* Why now is the time to modernize your communications capabilities
* Workplace experience: Why evergreen is everything


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


**Benefits**
 Find out more about some of our benefits here.
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look! T
 **ogether we do what matters** 
 .
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by

 Accelerate the impact of our people by

title: Developer Experience Engineer, Platform
description:
**Job Description**
* Design, develop, operate, and maintain cutting-edge solutions that allow for reuse and extensibility while solving primary problems at scale.
* Build and maintain backend solutions, working in the code to understand at a detailed level how the software works.
* Cultivate a deep understanding of how your systems impact our developers and other systems.
* Help grow other engineers technically by mentoring, pairing, and developing learning opportunities.
* Contribute to a culture of engineering excellence and strengthen the technical expertise of our engineering and product teams.
* Drive data-driven decisions to enhance the developer experience and implement proactive changes impacting the entire organization.


**Our humble expectations**
 Must haves:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Developer Experience Engineer, Backend Engineer, or similar role.
* 6+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
* Strong understanding of software development processes and best practices.
* Proficiency in or willingness to learn at least one of the following programming languages: Python3, Go (we primarily use Python and Go in our team).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Proactive, data-driven mindset with the ability to drive changes that impact the entire organization.
* Strong working knowledge of databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra.


 Nice to haves:
   

  

* If you have done any of the following, Nodejs, TypeScript, and ReactJS or Rust.
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Buildkite, Argo Workflows, or similar.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation (e.g., Python, Bash, Go).
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with Bazel, Spinnaker, and other build and deployment tools.
* Knowledge of package management, compliance & validations, and metrics.
* Experience in supporting large-scale development teams across multiple locations.
* Familiarity with on-call rotations and SOX compliance.
* Experience with asynchronous event streaming platforms or message queues (e.g., Kafka).


**Next Steps**
* Lots of room to build the direction of product management at Wolt, with a global impact!
* You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above.
